direccion: Junin St Oe1-61 y Flores, Quito 170150 Ecuador
descripcion: Friends Hotel & Rooftop is located in the Historic Center of Quito, with an incredible terrace to admire the sunset of the city and with mountain views. Since the opening of the Hotel, we have received guests from all over the world, offering a world-class service, our cozy hotel has been created with the comfort of our guests in mind. Our rooms offer quality and comfort to each guest, as well as the facilities that we have in the hotel. Our staff is trained to provide you with the best care. Visit us, we will be happy to receive you.

comentarios.p_comentario: Buena ubicación, personal muy amable, la relación calidad precio fue excelente. La amable bienvenida por parte de Yale fue de lo mejor, la habitación estaba muy bien equipada y tenía una vista magnifica a la virgen del Panecillo. Lo recomendaré.

Awesome area & safe. Staff was amazing and accommodating. They reached out two weeks before via WhatsApp for help with airport transfer and booking a tour. Would absolutely return! They made our trip very special and answered all of our questions. They were available via WhatsApp for communication and gave great recommendations!

Exelente servicio muy acogedor lindo lugar todos muy amables ubicado en un muy buen sitio muy buena la comida y las habitaciones limpias y acogedoras un lugar muy bonito como para volver en otro momento

Toll gelgen in der Altstadt in einem hostorischen Gebäude.  Das Personal ist hilfreich.  Das Früstuck ist schmackhaft.  Sehr flexible Hilfe bei Ausflügen und der Weiterreise.  Vom Rooftop perfekte Aussicht auf die Stadt und die Maria Statue.

A unique and incredible experience was the trip to the Quilotoa lagoon, we visited incredible places, we shared with the indigenous family, the Andean landscape painting gallery, the song the beautiful lagoon David, our very friendly guide explained us about the culture, history and the nature of that area of Ecuador, he came down with us and was always helping us, the descent to the water was a challenge and the return was difficult for this reason we took a mule, the food was delicious, the driver very friendly and the car comfortable and unique . It was a really increíble tour.

Mi habilitación estaba limpia y contaba con una buena vista a la virgen del Panecillo, la ubicación es perfecta y en una zona tranquila. El personal era amable y encantador. El desayuno fue abundante y delicioso. Si quieres conocer Quito te recomiendo quedarte en este hotel. Muchas gracias a todo el personal en especial a Yale, Lizardo y Henry 😊

Lovely and very professional staff, they helped me plan my whole trip in Ecuador giving me tips on what places to visit and what activities to do, the welcome by Yale was amazing and the breakfasts made by Lizardo I am sure were the best I tasted in Ecuador. The hotel has a beautiful facade, the location is good and it also has a small cafeteria. I love this place.

FRIENDS un hotel excelente para disfrutar en familia, con una vista priviligeada y hermosa al centro historico . La atención de los chicos y chicas es cordial y amigable,los desayunos son exquisitos y nutritivos . Las habitaciones son acogedoras , limpias y confortables muy bonitas para descansar. En mi próxima visita volvere a Friens muy buena atención 😊

Excelente predisposición de los señores y señoriras empleados  para la atención de nosotros los visitantes del hotel, tiene espacios acogedores sus recamaras son confortables y una vista increiblemente hermosa simplemente un lugar fantástico para hospedarse. Muchas gracias Hotel Friends

Me quedé en el hotel Friends por trabajo ñ, pero fue una gran elección. El lugar era muy acogedor y la habitación tenía un pequeño escritorio donde podía trabajar con mi laptop. La terraza tenía una linda vista y los desayunos eran deliciosos. En recepción siempre me ayudaron con la información que necesité. También tiene tienen un área con sillones y mesitas y una máquina de café.

direccion: Venezuela N8-26 y Manabi, Quito 170150 Ecuador
descripcion: Located in a restored colonial house of the 18th century, in the heart of the Historic Center of Quito 100 meters from the Sucre Theater, 200 meters from the Basilica and the presidential palace, close to all the tourist places of interest, monuments, squares, convents, churches and museums. It offers elegant and comfortable rooms with fixed internet connection and free Wi-Fi, telephone, satellite TV, heating, safety box and private bathroom with hot shower, hair dryer. Each room is unique, since they are decorated with different murals hand painted by artists from the Quito school of each church in Quito, the hotel has a classic decoration and furniture of colonial style in wood. Our guests can spend relaxing moments in our two patios, having a delicious breakfast with fresh fruit, or reading a book next to a beautiful vertical garden with a waterfall, from our viewpoint you can enjoy a 360 degree view of the entire center historical or visit our craft store.

comentarios.p_comentario: Hotel La Basilica is a wonderful small hotel right in the middle of Historic Quito. It’s just a few minutes walk to great restaurants, some interesting shops, and an in incredible mix of architecture, art, and museums. The grandeur of the various Catholic Churches is overwhelming. The veneration of the history and achievements of the local Quitu culture, dating back 10000 years is amazing.   Hotel la Basilica proved to be a wonderful place to stage our brief stay in Quito. Senora Mirian is wonderfully kind, as is everyone we got to know who works for her. Josue, who runs the desk, is an excellent host and was always eager to help us. The rooms are all great—comfortable and inviting.   The hotel is definitely a place to book if you’re traveling to Quito and want to stay in the historic section of town, close enough to walk anywhere in minutes and yet just out of the way enough to be quiet and peaceful.…

There are so many great things about this wonderful boutique hotel, but just to name a few:  (1) Location! Its located on a central street right in the historic district of Quito. So there are a LOT of churches, museums and restaurants within walking distance.   (2) Almost immediately upon booking, I received a message from Mr. Byron confirming my stay and offering to arrange door-to-door transportation from the airport to the hotel. Such a helpful service.  (3) I arrived later than expected and Mrs. Mirian (owner) graciously and enthusiastically greeted me at the door of the hotel upon arrival. I received a personal tour of the hotel on the same night of arrival and even visited the rooftop area to view the city at night and have my picture taken by Mrs. Mirian.  (4) The entire hotel is immaculate. The young lady who cleaned my room each day was beyond thorough. Literally, the floors glistened and not a single speck of dust/dirt/debris could be found after she finished. I even caught her scrubbing down the front door entrance to the hotel one morning.  (5) I was greeted each and every morning by Ms. Mirian, her husband or Josué before leaving the hotel for my tours (even at 6am)! The owners and staff are incredibly attentive and inviting. And you can sense the genuineness of their warmth.   (6) A hearty breakfast is prepared every morning and served in the courtyard. Its included in the price and usually consists of fresh juice, eggs to order, bread, a variety of fruit and great coffee.  (7) Amenities: The hotel offers laundry services, tour assistance and a quant cellar if you’re in need of local wine during your stay. The electrical outlets in the rooms are well-positioned. There is a small safe in the room (not quite large enough for laptop or larger items but more than sufficient).   (8) Security is important to me as a frequent solo female  traveler. The main entrance leads directly from the street and has double lock & bolt. Each boutique room has its own lock. You receive a key to the front entrance and a key to your private room upon check-in. There are cameras (not obtrusive) everywhere and someone to greet you each time you enter or exit. So I felt more than safe staying there.   Without reservation, I not only recommend this hotel but I will definitely stay again on my return trip to Quito.  Warm Regards, ~Cheryl~…

Great historic hotel only a couple blocks from many attractions in the historic center of Quito. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms were spacious. Breakfast was very good. Would definitely stay here again.

My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel La Basilica at the end of October and it was nothing short of incredible! The staff was so welcoming - giving us excellent advice, recommending cathedrals and museums to visit (all within walking distance of the hotel), making THE BEST coffee and breakfast in the mornings, and being so attentive to our needs. The rooms are gorgeous - wood floors, beautifully maintained architecture, comfy beds, beautiful murals… and it’s really neat to experience staying in a colonial style building in the heart of Quito. We adored this hotel and the staff (honestly don’t think I’ve stayed at an hotel where I feel that the staff were so lovely, attentive, and passionate about their city! They will give amazing recommendations!) and would absolutely recommend it to anyone visiting Quito!! Also the hotel was exceptionally clean.…

We’ll, all of the positive reviews, which propelled me to book here, were true! The arranged pick up and drop off to/from the airport were seamless, the owners and each worker at the hotel went above and beyond! The room was impeccable, the breakfast delicious, the central location easy to walk everywhere, and a beer on their top balcony with a view was amazing! Do not hesitate to book here!!

Hotel La Basilica is a must-stay if you ever travel to Quito! The amenities are beautiful and clean, the staff is incredibly thoughtful and we felt very well taken care of during our stay. They helped book transport, gave us tips while we were out on the streets and were available for help every hour of the day. And their breakfast was equally amazing!

This is some of the best hospitality I have received abroad! The attention to detail that the owners and staff put into the property is noticeable at every turn. The entire hotel is very well maintained and immaculate and Josue was an excellent reference for where to go in the city. Overall an excellent experience that made us love Quito all the more!

Das Hotel La Basilica in ein süßes Stadthotel in Quito. Die Lage ist ideal, um viele Sehenswürdigkeiten zu Fuß zu erreichen. Die Zimmer sind gut ausgestattet, der Service ist sehr gut und es gibt viele Erklärungen zu Quito und den einzelnen Sehenswürdigkeiten. Außerdem kann ein Hoteltransfer gegen Aufpreis (30$) einfach dazu gebucht werden. Es gibt ein leckeres Frühstück mit frischen Früchten und Eier Gerichte nach Wahl. das Hotel verfügt zusätzlich über eine kleine Dachterrasse mit einem tollen Blick über die Stadt Quito.

This stay was an excellent experience. Hotel employees were so friendly, accommodating, and professional. We were offered a historic tour of the facility, which really added to the experience. The rooftop view was spectacular. The location near downtown Quito made it easy to access many attractions by foot. I highly recommend Hotel La Basilica. Clean, beautiful, historic hotel.

Very good service and friendly staff. Josue was very helpful and the hotel is just blocks from everything. Delicious breakfast and clean rooms made this a perfect place to stay when in Quito.   Fantastic roof top view of the neighborhood only a short walk up the hill to Basilica del Voto Nacional. Lots of shopping and food in every direction.   Very safe and clean. Don't hesitate to book this hotel for your stay.

direccion: Calle 24 de Septiembre S 2-389 Conector Alpachaca, Quito 170907 Ecuador
descripcion: Eb Hotel By Eurobuilding Quito Airport, is the second installment of the EB brand from the Eurobuilding Hotels chain, which is known providing a 5-star service and a luxury design experience throughout all of its 9 properties, located throughout Venezuela, Argentina and the United States. EB Hotel is open Since Octuber 2017. The EB Hotel is located just 8 minutes away from the new Mariscal Sucre International Airport in Quito at the area of Tababela, Metropolitan District of Quito. We are close to the different locations preferred by visitors, 30 minutes away from the city’s historic center and other tourist attractions such as the Andean mountain range, the Cotopaxi volcano and 20 minutes away from the center of the world. Other beautiful landscapes, like the Quilatoa volcano, are easily accessed as well. The hotel has been specially designed for business travelers, tourists and families in general, offering comfort, service and spaces that will inspire you and make your stay a pleasant experience.

comentarios.p_comentario: Excelente el hotel es hermoso sus habitaciones muy acogedoras,  la piscina deliciosa y su personal es excelente la atención que nos dan como huéspedes es muy agradable y te sientes en casa lo recomiendo 1000%

Fantastic hotel, with a beautiful decor, rooms very comfortable, magic beds, and the most important the people. Everybody on the hotel it’s always ready to help to make your stay much more comfortable that you could spect. By far my best estoy in Quito metropolitan area.

Eb Hotel is a wonderfully modern hotel with excellent service! Convenient to the Quito airport and a nice resting spot before or after any visit to the Galapagos. While not located in the Old Town, it is only a 1/2 hour ride away. They also provided transportation to the airport.

Como siempre excelente la estadia, muy confortable, se siente como en casa. El servicio más que excelente, el personal muy amable, en el top es el # 1 de los hoteles que he vistitado. Muy muy recomendado.

Each time I stay at EB I have a superb experience. The staff were very attentive and treated me very well. If you are looking for a quiet, comfortable  and beautiful hotel. EB should be your first choice.

@EurobuildingQuito un lugar muy acogedor , Limpio en su totalidad , me encanto todo , las áreas externas super lindas , respiras aire puro , las habitaciones super Relajantes y comodas , su personal super cordiales y amables . Un saludo a los chicos del área de recepción por tan gentil trato .  Quiero resaltar el área del servicio del restaurante  Sus platillos exquisitos y muy buena atención .  Felicidades   Y agradecerle a los que desde la llegada al restaurante mostraron una  cálida bienvenida.  Los chicos Euvi , Freddy y  Daniela , Gracias por todo y por mostrarse tan servicial en todo momento. Gracias , espero volver algún otro día

This hotel is our new favorite when flying in or out of Quito.  Their shuttle service is great and was there to greet us even though our flight time had changed.  They have helped us with 'early check-in and late check-out requests.  The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful.  The rooms are very nice and comfy and the breakfasts are great.   Looking forward to coming back soon on our next trip. We can highly recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Hotel with a great location if you search a short stay in Quito. If you are traveling on business, this is the perfect hotel for you. Staff is very accommodating and attentive. In addition, facilities are excellent.

Siempre es una maravillosa experiencia. Nos hemos alojado unas tres veces ya en este hotel, siempre con amigos y familia. La verdad lo hemos hecho para escapar de la rutina de Quito y por disfrutar un poco la piscina y el buen clima de Tababela.   La comida del restaurante es muy buena, el servicio del personal también.  Definitivamente es un lugar al que siempre que podamos volveremos.

Spectacular hotel.  Everything was very clean.  The front desk went out of their way to be helpful. They stored my bags several times while I did multi-day tours in other places.  The room was large and very comfortable.  Security was great,  you needed a key to go up the elevators to the rooms.  The restaurant had good food.  The gym was well equipped and clean.  The spa was great.  This is the only place that I will stay when I'm in Quito.

direccion: Parroquia Tababela SN Via A Yaruqui, Quito 170103 Ecuador
descripcion: Offering complimentary WiFi and free parking, this hotel is located half a mile away from Mariscal Sucre International Airport. Every room at this hotel is air conditioned and is fitted with a 51 inches flat-screen TV. Some units include a seating area where you can relax. You will find a coffee machine in the room. The rooms are fitted with a private bathroom equipped with a shower and enjoyable amenities. Enjoy memorable meals at Gran Condor Restaurant or the 24-hour roomservice at the property. Mall del Cielo Shopping Center, located inside the Airport is just steps away from this modern hotel.

comentarios.p_comentario: Excelente servicio en todas las zonas. Luis, Vanessa y Geomara tienen muy buena actitud, amabilidad y profesionalismo. Nada que agregar al hotel, habitaciones muy cómodas, volvería cada vez que venga a Quito.

Placentera estadía en el hotel, disfruté la tranquilidad, el entorno silencioso y la habitación confortable que me asignaron. Me gustó la gentil amabilidad de su personal,  en todo lo que necesite recibí una atención personalizada y muy cálida.

Poder ter feito esta noite de descanso, antes da viagem de volta, foi espetacular! O hotel é lindo, muito silencioso (mesmo estando há poucos metros do aeroporto) e todas as áreas (tanto os quartos, quanto as áreas de convivência) são extremamente espaçosas e confortáveis. A arquitetura e o design são modernos e elegantes. Foi um prazer ter me hospedado neste hotel.

Desde que llegué con mi familia de USA, nos recibieron con mucha amabilidad, nos dirigieron en todo. En el 4to piso, el club, nos brindaron bocadillos deliciosos y bebidas gratis. Incluso pudimos ver partidos de fútbol americano. Viajamos con mi pequeña bebe de casi 2 años y todos nos trataron con mucha paciencia. En el restaurante me dieron recomendación de comida dado que llegué sentida del estómago. Una verdadera bendición haber venido a este hotel.

El hotel bonito y limpio. La cercanía con el aeropuerto ayuda en caso de vuelos de llegada o salida a la media noche. Tienen transporte en circuito al aeropuerto cada 30 minutos. La comida muy buena. Lo que no me gustó es que el ruido de los autos y camiones que pasan en la autopista que está en la parte trasera del hotel son muy notorios en la habitación, sobre todo en las noches. También un problema con la llave electrónica me hicieron tener que reactivarla todas las tarde en la recepción.

Excelente Servicio y Cómodas Instalaciones, alimentos y bebidas con excelente sabor, personal muy amable y dispuesto a servir, la reservación y check in lo hice en línea no tuve ninguna demora al ingreso y salida del Hotel! espectacular!

I spent one night in this airport hotel on my arrival to Quito. There is a shuttle available every 30 minutes and the hotel is only 3 minutes away by car from the terminal, We arrived late at night but check in was smooth and room was large. Excellent buffet morning breakfast. The hotel was also very accommodating on our return day, when we had a late flight and chose to have dinner there. Even if we were no longer staying there, they provided for luggage storage and the shuttle, while we were able to eat dinner at their restaurant, a very good dinner with extensive menu and large sized plates. I would definitely stay there again.

El personal de limpieza no reportó el cargador de mi celular que dejé olvidado.  A pesar que llame a recepción, que se quedó mi compañera de trabajo un día mas en el hotel, que ambos reportaron el incidente, nadie hizo nada por recuperar mi cargador.  No pude conectarme con el hotel porque las lineas siempre están ocupadas.

El hotel es impecable, muy limpio, super amplio, comodisimas camas, buen personal (amable, educado, servicial) la comida muy buena. El servicio de traslado del y al aeropuerto es perfecto, puntual y comodo

Todo muy bien, buena atencion, habitacion de primera. Un excelente lugar y la comida es lo mejor, tienes mucha variedad en el desayuno buffete, el servicio a la habitacion 24 horas de primera. Sin duda muy recomendado.

direccion: Alemania E5 103 Av. La Republica, Quito 170150 Ecuador
descripcion: This recently renovated Wyndham Garden hotel offers free wifi, free parking and the most convenient location. Walking distance to El Jardin Shopping Mall, next to La Carolina Central Park, near Metropolitano Guanguiltagua Park, in the heart of the bustling downtown area. It offers easy access to our community’s major attractions such as the Guayasamin Museum and Quito Exposition Center. This awarded hotel also features a Restaurant with healthy breakfast, a la carte lunch and dinner are available every day, 24 hours Roomservice and well-equipped Meeting Rooms. There is so much to do just steps from our door. Go on a shopping spree, visit a zoo, or discover historic sites around the city. There are also several local businesses in the area, making our hotel the perfect place to work and play.

comentarios.p_comentario: El servicio ha sido excelente. Cometí un error al realizar la reserva y supieron ayudarme con una solución rápidamente. En el restaurante destacó por mucho el servicio de “Luis” quien no atendió con una cortesía sobresaliente. La propuesta gastronómica es fenomenal. Tuvimos un pequeño problema con un plato sin embargo supieron reinvindicarse rápidamente. Estoy completamente satisfecho en especial con el servicio de Luis que ha destacado por su gentiles y don de servicio

Excelente atención su personal muy atento y disponible a mis solicitudes , las habitaciones muy acogedoras limpias y cómodas ! Y su ubicación es excelente está cerca de todo en la capital ! La comida muy variada y rica servida con un personal muy atento y de primera !! Muy recomendado

En medio de la emergencia de mi viaje Miami Quito, la satisfacion,y la calidad de servicio que me Brandon el personal de Reception,restaurant, habitacion,ha sido una feliz experiencia en el tiempo de mi estadia, Principalmente el charisma y education Corfial de Liliana Ulloa  front desk manager es lo mejor experiencia.Conclusion Agradecido,complacido en mi estadia Gracias gracias Gonzalo Aliaga

The service here was amazing! Everyone was so friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfy. It is also in a great location across the street from a park, the botanical garden, the mall, and only a short taxi/Uber ride to the teleférico. Last but not least, the breakfast was delicious! They change their dishes everyday. Pictured are the dishes that were served on the last day. I definitely recommend.

Excellent service and food! The staff and the hotel room exceeded all my expectations! Breakfast always had variety and was delicious! Also the manager Nelson was so accommodating to my friends and I.

Excellent hotel to rest, friendly people, clean room, very good internet connection, comfortable bed and delicious breakfast, best of all, the coffee maker in the room, we love coffee when we arrive at night

Visite el restaurante muy buena comida y excelente atención.  La colada morada por la temporada espectacular. Muy recomendado.  Recomiendo el lugar se puede almorzar en familia y sobretodo las opciones para niños variada y deliciosa.  La atención de sus empleados muy amable y estuvieron pendientes en todo momento

Fui a disfrutar de la deliciosa colada morada, la verdad deliciosa al igual que las guaguas de pan rellenas que estuvieron espectaculares, espero volver pronto y degustar del almuerzo bufet que es espectacular

Acogedor y excelente servicio!  Todas las instalaciones del hotel ordenadas, limpias, el personal muy amable y muy buena ubicación dentro de Quito, al frente del Parque La Carolina.  Muy recomendable 🙂

La atención ha sido magnífica. Todo el personal es amabilísimo, siempre dispuesto a ayudar. Mención especial a Luis, que nos trató con mucho cariño. El desayuno es espectacular. El resto de las comidas están muy bien también.  La habitación es cómoda y suficientemente amplia y tiene muchos enchufes. La cama muy cómoda. El baño tiene todo lo necesario. Aún así, hay algunos aspectos a mejorar. Los muebles de la habitación son antiguos. La iluminación es suficiente pero podría mejorarse. Las ventanas no tienen doble acristalamiento y se escucha bastante el ruido exterior. No hay sistema de climatización aunque realmente nosotros no lo necesitamos.

direccion: Joaquin Pinto E4-376 y Juan León Mera La Mariscal, Quito 170118 Ecuador
descripcion: Situated in the heart of Quito, Boutique Hotel Casa Joaquin "Logis de Charme" is a small oasis of comfort, peace and tranquility. It is a delightful mix of European tradition and contemporary trend. The Casa Joaquin-team welcomes you in an authentic colonial house with newly decorated guest rooms. Year round, your affordable and luxurious starting point for pleasure and for business in enchanting Ecuador. Located in the historical city center of QuitoHotel Casa Joaquin "Logis de Charme" is located in a safe neighborhood in the heart of the historic city of Quito. The touristic hotspots, business centers, markets and the popular “La Mariscal” barrio are at walking distance of the hotel. In this area you can arrange any trip of adventure you have in mind or submerge yourself in the rich nightlife and enjoy the splendid culture and art this country has to offer. The hotel is 45 minutes away from the airport. We provide a pick-up and shuttle service. Boutique Hotel Casa Joaquin "Logis de Charme" has 14 brand new guest rooms, designed with taste and dedicated to a peaceful and comfortable stay. Our excellent beds with orthopedic mattresses and pillows with anti-mites treatment, guarantee a good night’s rest. All rooms have a private bathroom and meet to 4-star European standards.

comentarios.p_comentario: מקום מקסים שממוקם במרכז העיר ליד הכיכר המרכזית. פרנסיסקו, בעל המקום, בעל תודעת שרות גבוהה והופך עולמות בכדי להנעים את שהותינו במקום (2 משפחות, 10 אנשים). המלון בנוי בטיב טעם ומעוצב יפה, החדרים גדולים ונקיים והמקלחות מרווחות ומודרניות. ארוחת הבוקר מוכנת לפי בקשת הלקוח במקום. מומלץ.

I recently stayed here twice during my trip to Ecuador. Everything was fantastic! The rooms were clean, breakfast was fabulous and Francisco was very accomodating, kind and interesting to talk to. I highly recommend staying here!

If you are himhawing around about where to stay in Quito, just book it.  You will not be disappointed.   In fact, you will be pleasantly surprised.  The hotel is absolutely charming!  Clean and comfy beyond expectation. Francisco and his family will go out of their way to make your stay welcoming.  Breakfast is included.  Also, if you need a ride from the airport he will book a cab for you at a very reasonable rate.  Good neighborhood.  Close to restaurants.   Just do it!

The hotel is nice with modest rooms; there isn't any A/C, but they do provide a fan. The hotel provides toiletries, a hairdryer, and strong wifi. You have to buzz to be let in, which is typical of Quito. There is an ADA room on the ground floor, and the bar and breakfast area are also on the ground floor. Additionally there's a convenience store on the corner by plaza foch called Listo! if you need drinks or snacks, and there are several restaurants within walking distance.

The staff was exceptional including the driver they arranged to pick us up at the airport and take us on a day tour. Shout out to Francisco and Javier for going out of their way to make us feel welcome. The entire place was ultra cozy and the breakfast was great! Overall, a wonderful experience and would definitely visit again!

Small charming boutique hotel, wonderful setting, very clean. It has the feel of  a dream traditional home, the room was spacious and charming, the bathroom modern and at the same time the design fit in with the traditional homey feel of the room. Staff friendly and very helpful, good breakfast. The location in the Mariscal Foch area with restaurants and night life. The big street near it closes for traffic on Sunday and the locals bike on it and through the nearby park, very cool. Felt like home and we didn’t want to leave.

Without Francisco our five-day stay in Quito would have been just-OK and this would have been a four-not-five star review; he was charming, knowledgeable, not pushy, and always available. His mom and wife also work in Casa Joaquin and they were lovely.  We paid extra for the apartment downstairs with a full kitchen and lots of storage, a queen bed in the bedroom, a twin in the living room, and a private lovely little courtyard.  Perfect except very moist/musty unlike the rest of the hotel. The bathroom was tiny, but the water super-hot (no bath).  La Mariscal is full of restaurants and hostels, and close to everything, but I would rather be in the Historic Center as a newcomer, or in parts north as a repeat visitor. Many stores on Av. Rio Amazonas, and 2 miles walkable to La Basilica via Parque El Ejido; a bit too far to walk to Iglesia San Francico the most beautiful church I have ever seen.  Francisco recommended the bland and safe 100% tourist-focused Miskay for dinner 1 block away. Not memorable, but excellent food.  We took Francisco's wonderful arranged private car/driver to Papallacta for a day of swimming and hiking $120+tip (more for spa and massages). We did not follow Francisco's recommendation of the Otalvo tour which would have been better for MOST tourists but not us.  The rooftop area was just OK.  Daily breakfasts were OUTSTANDING fresh local fruit fresh squeezed juices, delicious local farm eggs, croissants, toast, yogurt.    Francisco made a good stay great.…

We spent 5 nights in Quito at Casa Joaquin.  The hotel is well appointed, well cared for, very clean, and decidedly charming.  Francisco's level of service is truly wonderful.  He offered great tips for restaurants and sights, and helped arrange car service to and from Quito.  The breakfasts were delicious every morning and Francisco arranged an early breakfast for us when our bike tours had an early start.  I also just really enjoyed chatting with Francisco: he's thoughtful, kind, and very interesting!  The location provided easy access to the Old Town and up to Parque La Carolina.  Good restaurants and nightlife nearby.  Highly recommended!

What a nice place.. clean and comfortable. Francisco did a great job in accommodating my every need.  Nice rooms, good breakfast. I recommend this place to stay. What bothers me about TripAdvisor is when I do a review, this section has to be 200 characters.. that's BS

I wanted to make sure I took the time to write this when we teturned from Quito. I almost never write reviews but this was worth one. We stayed at Hotel Joaquin for two nights before traveling to the Galapagos. Francisco arranged a driver to meet us at the airport - he was there to greet us upon our arrival and was very knowledgeable about the city.   The hotel is really cute, nicely decorated and very well kept. But it’s the service that most impressed us. Francisco is a one-man show! He was there to greet us, prepared our breakfast in the am, showed us where to go on the map, organized a driver to help us navigate the city and gave us a recommendation for a place to have a really lovely lunch. He was there in the evening to pour us a glass of wine at the bar and he was also up super early when we had to check out to go to the Galapagos - he even made us coffee and breakfast croissants to go -  at 5 am!! highly recommend this hotel and hope you will check it out too. You will not be disappointed!!…

direccion: Bolivar Oe6-41 y Cuenca, Quito 170150 Ecuador
descripcion: Situated in a newly-restored historic mansion overlooking Plaza San Francisco, the three-story Casa Gangotena harbours 31 rooms, a showcase of eye-catching style, contemporary design, antiques, fine furnishings, modern technologies and quintessential comfort.

comentarios.p_comentario: Fui con mis tíos y padres por mi graduación. Recomendaría mejorar el servicio ya que esperamos un buen rato para que nos tomaran la orden y se complicaba porque no tenían la carta en físico y mis familiares no manejan bien sus celulares. Entonces sólo podíamos ver en un dispositivo para 8 personas. Luego nos pasaron la carta de comida pero mis parientes al ser personas mayores no podían ver claramente los nombres de los platillos y era entendible por el color café y gris que se confunde con el papel del menú.  Afortunadamente, una mesera fue muy atenta y nos explicó la carta. Recomendaría poner colores más fáciles de leer y tener la carta de vinos en físico. La comida  estuvo estupenda.

We stayed four nights in a plaza view room. The room had ornate ceiling and wall detail, marble bathroom, very comfortable king bed, and windows opening up to the plaza below. We really enjoyed having this view as there is much going on every day in the plaza. We also had fun sitting on the steps watching the pigeons, people and activity.   All staff were friendly and attentive. They served a nice breakfast each day with eggs to order, one morning they had a buffet. Recommend the Cafe Quinteno which was delicious! Another highlight was a half day private city tour with Juan Carlos, who the Concierge arranged for us. Memorable time!

The service was outstanding. The staff was incredible and the food was awesome. We took a Chocolate Quiteño tour and was amazing. Our room was nice and the hotel is beautiful. We truly recommend to stay at this hotel. We definitely visit again.

A beautiful property, with impeccably appointed rooms, extremely pleasant staff and a wonderful location overlooking Plaza San Francisco. The hotel is steps away from the Museo del Alabado and some of Quito’s most significant churches (San Francisco, la Compañía, etc.). Breakfast in the atrium or the main dining room overlooking the Plaza are thoroughly relaxing experiences. The hotel offers a great location from where to walk around the old downtown, with its squares, plazas and remarkable architecture. While the location of the hotel does not lend itself to safely going out at night (an unfortunate reality in much of Latin America) it also has a very good restaurant and a great bar.

The rooms are SO comfortable and historical luxurious decor with all the modern conveniences.  You feel like you are in a mansion, yet you have free Internet wireless at a high speed and fantastic bar/restaurant staff.  You are only steps away from the San Francisco square and many other historical landmarks and feel completely safe 24x7.

la casa gangotena is undoubtedly one of the best hotels that the capital can offer, the attention and service are formidable. The location in the historic center makes it an incredible place surrounded by history and Quito culture. Highly recommended, you won't regret it !

We spent just one night here. The public rooms are beautiful, and our bedroom was nice - although could have done with two comfy chairs. The service in the restaurant was pretty slow at dinner - and a snail's pace at breakfast which was a problem as we had to leave at a certain time. perhaps a buffet might have helped things along a bit rather than everything being served - it meant we didn't;t get our full breakfast.   This is in the same group as Mashpi and Finch Bay, both of which we also stayed in but it fell well behind their standards of service. However like both of these the menu was only available on devices which is a real problem for some people.   For something that is in such an iconic building it was a bit disappointing.

We had a 3 night stay in a Plaza view room. All the staff from the gentlemen at the door who opened it for us countless times, to reception, the concierge and in the bar and restaurant couldn't have been more welcoming and attentive.  Our room on the first floor was immaculate in cleanliness and decor.  The step into the bath to use the shower is quite high though for we older guests.  Location is on San Francisco plaza in the historical centre of Quito with shops, restaurants and museums nearby.  Breakfast is sometimes a buffet with plenty of choice and a selection of a la carte items freshly prepared.  One day we ordered a la carte only as there was no buffet set out.  We had dinner in the restaurant and the portions were generous and the food nicely presented.  We also had the Cafe Quiteno or high tea that was a very pleasant experience complete with a timer to brew your cup of tea for the right amount of time.  The garden with the fountain is a lovely, quiet place to sit and watch the doves that frequent it.  Displays of roses were on view in various places around the hotel and they are stunning, I never tired of seeing them.  We truly appreciated the service we received from all staff who made us feel very welcome.…

The hotel is in a great location near to all the sights. However we were very disappointed with the service - the staff were very disorganised. We had booked for dinner but they didn’t seem to be aware of it and led us to 3 different tables before finally sitting us in a different, and very cold, restaurant (someone eventually brought in a portable heater). The food was very average, not the usual Relais and Chateau standard. My husbands steak was very tough and chewy, even though it was cooked medium rare. Our room, a Junior Balcony suite, was on the first floor above the kitchen and bar. It was very noisy with doors banging all day and night. On the second night we were woken by banging and hammering and had to phone down to reception to complain. When we checked out the girl was very disinterest in our complaints.  We won’t be returning!…

Gracias! While often stated to us during our stay, we are truly grateful for the service and experience provided by all of the staff. From arrival to departure, every person with whom we interacted was an absolute pleasure. I will write more about our stay, but have to board a plane for our next adventure in the Amazon.

direccion: Avenida Orellana 1172 y Avenida Amazonas, Quito 170150 Ecuador
descripcion: Visit Quito, Ecuador in style when you stay at JW Marriott Hotel Quito. Our luxury hotel is ideally located near the area's best dining, shopping, attractions and entertainment. Get to Galapagos Islands and Santo Domingo's Church easily from our Quito hotel. Take advantage of our full service spa, decadent restaurants, state-of-the-art fitness center and gorgeous pool.

comentarios.p_comentario: My family and I stayed here for 2 nights before our trip to Galápagos.    I contacted Concierge via email in advance of our trip and they (Fernando & Alejandra) were super helpful in arranging dinner reservations for our 2 nights.   While the hotel looks a bit aged and needs some refurb, the staff, from bell men to front desk to exec lounge to restaurants, are all incredible friendly and helpful.   Breakfast quality was very good as was the variety.    A good choice for your stay in Quito

Stated 3 nights pre Galapagos Cruise in room 811, and one night room 735 on return. Very spacious and well appointed. Excellent internet which we needed for work. Beautiful hotel overall with great meal choices, beautiful pool area. Service was first rate from checkin to arranging private drivers and tours.   Special kudos to Fabian at the front desk who tracked down my misplaced cellphone for me on Aeromexico and arranged a reuniting. Truly service above and beyond and a bit of a lifesaver as we are mobile dependent these days.   As good as any Marriott we have stayed in and at a very good price. All staff spoke good English (good since our Spanish sucks).

Estuve de viaje con mi esposo y temas de negocios, la habitacion estuvo muy chida, la atencion fue excelente desde que llegue el doorman me ayudo, la recepcion fue amable y lo mejor fue el desayuno, hay tamales y una salsa picante deliciosa. La hostess estuvo pendiente todo el tiempo. realmente buen servicio.  La piscina es perfecta, un poco fria al principio pero te acostumbras ! seguro volvemos

Beautiful hotel and the room is very spacious for a standard room! Check in was easy and all the staff were very pleasant and friendly! The bell man got my luggage and got to my room promptly! There were two bottles of water provided in our room! There’s an empty mini fridge in the room, so you can use it for your own stuff!  There’s a restaurant close by that’s pretty good, a 5 minute walk! It was about 45 mins drive from Quito airport!

The best Marriott we've ever stayed in! From the design of the hotel to the guest room, the restaurants to the staff, every single thing was simply perfect. Fabulous restaurants with great food and great service. The staff cares and it shows! The entire kitchen staff came out after one dinner and asked to take their picture with us! We cannot recommend this hotel enough. It was the host hotel for our Galapagos trip and just added to the entire experience!

While waiting for our Galapagos trip to begin, we were fortunate to stay at this JW Marriott. So not to get caught up in some civil protests in Quito, we opted to stay in and dine at their new restaurant Raices. Little did we know how new it was until we walked in and we treated like celebrities!. Unwhittingly, we were the very first customers to walk in their doors! After celebratory drinks we were treated with an exquisite plate of a delicious scallop appetizer. Then of course we had to try this and that from the menu and enjoyed every bite. Sauces were prepared at the table and we even got more desserts after our deserts! kudos to the fabulous chef and his team!

Excellent hotel. Exceded my expectations. Top Noch service. Daniela and Oscar from the reception made our stay very special and took great care of us and our twins.  They were always amazingly polite and professional. Fabian and Francisco at the executive lounge were extremely kind with us. Our kids enjoyed beautiful live piano at the lobby and a refreshing pool every day. Beautiful flower decorations made our stay unforgettable. We would be delighted to come back.

I had the pleasure to travel to Quito for business and staying at JW Marriott. This is an amazing option to stay in Quito, Ecuador. Front desk representative Gabriela went out of her way and gave an extra mile to make sure that my time was extraordinary. Where to start, Check in was good, room was impecable, breakfast and all food in general were very tasty. The check out was really nice with an extraordinary surprise! Thank you so very much to all!

It is located near many shops and restaurants that are all walkable if there is no rain.  The hotel is gorgeous, very spacious, high end quality and very luxurious at a fair price.  The staff is also helpful and extraordinary for most needs.  The downside is when big cruise ship tours come in, the place gets crowded and chaotic.

Excellent service , a real can do attitude, typical JWM rooms, had benefit of upgrade due to my Ambassador Elite status  Excellent lounge on 9th floor nice views and full breakfast with Omelet station.  Also had meal in Botanica on the lower level also good with exemplary service  The concierge, Ayquel Garzon, could not have been more attentive. The city itself is very friendly and clean. Highly recommend visiting Quito and do stay at the JW.

direccion: Calle Venezuela OE3 - 85 con Calle Rocafuerte, Quito 170150 Ecuador
descripcion: Between modern facilities and colonial architecture, Masaya Hostel Quito perfectly mixes the spirit of a hostel and the comfort of a hotel. In a 2,000 square meters colonial house located in the heart of historical center of Quito, the most preserved of all Latin America and declared USNESCO World Heritage in 1978, Masaya Hostel features dorms, private rooms, a bar, a restaurant, a movie room and a large open-air garden. Masaya also offers cultural activities & events to immerge their guests in the local Ecuadorian culture.

comentarios.p_comentario: Our family of four (2 kids under 12) had a wonderful stay at Masaya Quito. We landed there three different times during our time in Ecuador and it was the "perfect" home base. We loved the spacious family room (2 bedrooms; 1 king, and 2 bunks). All beds were extremely clean and comfortable. We also frequented Masaya's restaurant. Excellent food, staff and ambiance. Great overall value, and location. We have already recommended Masaya to others!

Wunderbares Hostel mit grossen Zimmern und tollem Restaurant. Die Mitarbeiter sind sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Wir haben uns sehr wohl gefühlt und kommen auch wieder  Hilfreich ist, dass der Reisende z. B. auch Adapterstecker günstig erwerben kann  Wunderbar wäre es noch gewesen, einen Papierkorb im Zimmer zu haben und ein paar Haken zum Sachen aufhängen.

I really enjoyed receptionist and their ability to help in any case :). On the other hand, I really did not have such bad company in dorms like this. People didn't care about others, they were calling after 10:00 PM loudly from the bed... The floor in the dorms is making sounds so it was not very possible to sleep calmly. Also the curtain in the beds were making so much noise every time when somebody wante to come to bed or left bed ... :D It was funny but annoying in the same time.  However, the biggest disadvantage was missing cultery in the kitchen. There were really just few bowls, spoons, knifes (sharp one the best). We came in "non-touristic" period so I believe it can be even worse during busy period.  Enyway, I enjoyed my stay and thank you. This is just for your improvements :).…

There’s not a bad thing that one can say about Masaya Quito! The staff are so friendly, kind and helpful - they know your name and make you feel welcome. The rooms are very modern, clean and comfortable. They have a restaurant, tons of lounge space, a full kitchen and offer tours to everywhere you’d like to go. I wouldn’t stay anywhere else in Quito.

Excellent staff and nice colonial building with modern facilities, common area/kitchen and garden. Well situated for seeing the sites in the Centro historico.  Restaurant serves good breakfast and dinner. A little on the expensive side, and could use more local options, but suits the moderate price range it aims for.  If I were to stay in the Centro historico again, I would probably explore other accommodation options but would be happy to stay at Masaya if it was the best value again.

Die Lage direkt am historischen Zentrum ist wirklich super. Wir hatten die Superior Zimmer. Groß, sauber und zweckmäßig eingerichtet. Leider sehr laut. Die meisten Zimmer sind zur Straße gerichtet. Und die kann auch nachts sehr laut werden. Die Fenster halten kaum was auf. Da muss nachgebessert werden. Aber die Lage, das leckere Frühstück, die Gemeinschaftsbereiche machen es wieder gut. Auch wird jeden Morgen eine freewalking Tour angeboten.   Tip. Absolute Empfehlung das Altamira Restaurant wo es das Frühstück gibt. Leckeres und preiswertes Essen und ein super Kochkurs.

We stayed 3 nights in Masaya with friends. Overall, the place is nice, secured and like an oasis inside Quito. The staff is friendly and helpful.  However, we had a hard time to sleep because our room was above the kitchen and we were getting a lot of noise from the ventilation/electricals and because of the very thin windows (that were also not closing properly).   The room also had a terrible smoking smell - from previous guest, probably.

Ubicado estrategicamente en el centro histórico de Quito, donde te podras desplazar fácilmente a museos, iglesis ,parques y demas lugares historicos. Masaya te ofrece un tour gratuito donde visitas algunos calles, iglesias y parte de centro histórico.  De mis ultimos viajes, es la mejor cama en que he dormido , buen servicio, espacios agradables y confortables,buena comida, atendida por el chef del restaurante.

Sehr angenehmer Aufenthalt. Kann ich nur empfehlen. Würde wieder hier übernachten. Die Ausstattung ist schön(schöne Bilder, gepflegte Räumlichkeiten). Gutes Essen. Nicht weit entfernt vom El Panecillo. Das Personal ist sehr hilfreich.

We stayed at masaya with our two kids ages 9 and 8. The room was excellent for families and the location was very walkable to many activities. The food at the hotel was good as well. It was a very good experience! The only negative is the area is noisy but I do not think that can be avoided in old town Quito.

Gracias! While often stated to us during our stay, we are truly grateful for the service and experience provided by all of the staff. From arrival to departure, every person with whom we interacted was an absolute pleasure. I will write more about our stay, but have to board a plane for our next adventure in the Amazon.

direccion: Calle Benalcazar N9-53 y Oriente, Quito 170150 Ecuador
descripcion: This cozy Ecofriendly & Experience Hotel Boutique is a completely restored colonial style old house, located on the traditional Benalcazar Street, 500 metres from Plaza de la Independencia, museums and colonial churches, 400 metres from Quito's Basilica del Voto Nacional. Experience and enjoy a tasty variety of Ecuadorian and Andean breakfasts. Free Wi-Fi throughout the property is offered. Each room is fitted with: Private bathroom with rain shower, desk, flat-screen TV. English is spoken.

comentarios.p_comentario: I love Ecuatreasures Centro Historico, Quito, Ecuador!  Though we only visited for two days, our host, Hernán,  spent time with us fashioning the best possible vacation.  I definitely recommend following his advice- we had the best time, from exploring the local sights to booking a tour of Mindo, 2 hours from Quito, for incredible experiences of the biodiversity in Ecuador:  birds, butterflies, orchids, and chocolate (especially the chocolate!)   I loved the Ecuadoran breakfasts they served, and even had a gorgeous final dinner at Pim's Pacecillo Restaurant, overlooking the city for a delicious sunset/ moonrise dinner.    The hotel is on a flat part of an otherwise steep hill, but was manageable for us.  It's a two minute walk from the Cathedral!  The accommodations were beautiful and comfortable.  I will definitely go back!  Thank you Hernán and Blanca!  …

Those five stars one notes in the previous reviews, they are well earned and well deserved. Upon the start, after selecting this hotel, we were greeted with sincere and warm communications from Hernan, the patriarch of this family owned establishment. Throughout our stay, he was always available to ensure that our needs were taken care of: transportation and tour setup, suggestions on how to experience the Ecuadorian and Quito culture, setting up Covid-19 tests which were needed to return to our country and just plain and simple warm conversation.  The day was started with a wonderful breakfast. Each day something different representing a region of the country, was made by onsite manager. Johnny, the onsite manager, always smiled and was there to make that our stay was pleasant. Interacting with him was ever-so fun, his easy going spirit was contagious. We looked forward to seeing him upon returning to the hotel each day, sharing our adventures.  We were picked up at the airport by Joel, another easygoing member of the hotel family. From the start, he too was there for us if ever needed. Again, as with Hernan and Johnny, Joel was sincere and very pleasant to converse with. We also took a tour to the Middle of the Earth, local markets and restaurants and the Quito Teleferico. This tour was hosted by Joel, while he was an employee you felt like he was a friend.  My wife and I travel when possible, we have visited numerous countries and we have stayed in a wide spectrum of lodging options. This was truly the first time we greeted beyond the usually pleasantries, we felt as if we belonged.…

A lovely small hotel on the edge of the historical district. Rooms are very clean and have quite new and modern bathrooms. The owner, Hernan is very friendly and was present at breakfast time for a chat and to help serve breakfast in the very pleasant central atrium The entrance to the hotel is just plain door and you need a key to enter but even though I arrived after midnight, the caretaker was present to let me in. You need to know to press the intercom buzzer. I would suggest looking online at room options since not all rooms have exterior facing windows.  Mine had a row of small windows high up on one wall which only opened out to a corridor. Overall it is a very well presented hotel, good value for money and in a good location - enjoyed thoroughly my 4 night stay in Quito.

Ich fand das Hotel bei TripAdvisor, besonders fiel mir auf, das der Besitzer Hernán bei persönlichen Planungen hilft. So buchten wir das Haus vor und nach unserem Galapagos Ausflug erst 2 und dann drei Tage. Es hat etwa 8 Zimmer und ist sehr schön renoviert. Nach historischem Vorbild. Sehr schön. Unser Zimmer war klein, aber fein. Alles sehr, sehr sauber. Die Matratze war wundervoll. Es wird sehr viel Wert auf das einsparen von Ressourcen gelegt. Sparen müssen Sie jedoch selbst. Das Frühstück findet in einem lieblichen Innenhof statt und wird komplett frisch zubereitet. Allerdings sind die Portionen etwas klein. Es wurde uns bei allen Dingen geholfen, insbesondere der Taxenservice vom/zum Flughafen war hilfreich. Die Autos für Touren in Quito wurden uns bestellt (unfassbar preiswert, unbedingt Taxameter einstellen lassen). Das allerbeste war, das er uns einen Panflöte Spieler auf ein Restaurantdach organisiert hat. Alles in allem kann ich das Haus sehr empfehlen. Die Hausdame „Branca“ war sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend. Alles sehr familiär aber nicht zu aufdringlich.…

A beautiful boutique hotel in the historic center of Quito.  What sets Hotel Casa Ecuatreasures apart is the incredible personal attention provided by Hernan the manager and his staff.  Hernan designed a custom behind the scenes tour for my wife according to her unique interests, which he personally guided.  The tour included Corazon de Perro, a local street dog rescue, and other unique shops and craftspeople.  We could not be happier or recommend more highly!

Nothing to stop you from loving Quito and the old town. This medium size boutique hotel is where I stayed for 3 nights. I booked for first night of our three nights in Quito for concerns of such ….  After checking in, I decided to extend two more nights here. The host is one of the nicest I met in my travel career in Asia, in Europe, in North America, in Colombia and in Ecuador. Trust me you would love to stay here to chat. One more extra, the breakfast is one the memorable in life.

We stayed at Ecuatreasures in June of 22 and had an amazing stay!  Hernan runs a small but very welcoming hotel that feels like home. The room was comfortable (we chose the room with the king sized bed) and had its own balcony where you could sit and enjoy a glass of wine.  By far the best perk was the breakfast each morning.  Hernan and Blanca would prepare authentic Ecuadorian breakfasts each morning consisting of coffee, tea, fresh juice, eggs and a traditional dish made from locally sourced ingredients.  They also did an amazing job catering to our food allergies as well.  He even invited us to try homemade canelazo one evening which was absolutely delicious and warmed your body from the inside out. Hernan was very attentive to our needs.  He provided extra blankets and a carafe of water to our room each day, and upon learning I had gotten a bout of food poisoning at a local restaurant, asked Blanca to prepare me a pot of herbal tea that locals use to calm their stomachs (and it worked!)   He also offered private day tours to various sites around Quito but unfortunately we had booked our tours prior to learning that.  He also arranged a driver to pick us up from the airport and take us back for a very affordable price.  Overall I would highly recommend you stay at Ecuatreasures Centro Historico for a very short walk to the basilica and other historic sites in downtown Quito!…

Ecuatreasures is a basic hotel on a very steep hill in the capital city of Ecuador. Initially, I booked a room with a view of the ‘patio’, but that turned out to be the breakfast area, so I moved to a more expensive room with a view of the busy and noisy street.   I was warned that in spite of being on the Equator, weather can be cool in the mountains, but I wasn’t prepared for there being no indoor heating. The housekeeper wears a puffer jacket as she goes about her work, and I wished that I had one as well.   The owner, Hernán, works very hard at being liked and offered me drinks as well as frequently making suggestions for things that I might want to do or see.   This would be a good place to stay if you are warmly dressed and able to climb hills at a high altitude with less oxygen. It is clean and they provide a good breakfast.…

We spent two nights at this charming hotel in the historic center of Quito, on our way to the Galápagos Islands.  We were able to contact Hernan, the manager, soon after we made our reservations and were able to arrange for a pick up at the airport at midnight. The rooms were neat , comfortable and very clean. Both our rooms had a small balcony offering beautiful views of the city.  The small but charming courtyard was a great place to enjoy an authentic Ecuadorian breakfast!  We would certainly consider this place on a return visit to Quito

My wife and I stayed 2 nights.  The hotel is comfortable and welcoming.  Our room was clean, spacious and attractive with a bathroom featuring modern fixtures.  The hotel is located a few blocks from the Presidential Palace and Central Plaza as well as the Basilica so there are many places of interest within easy walking distance (but the district is quite hilly and at 9000 feet elevation so be prepared to be short of breath).  Hernan, the host, and Blanca, prepared a beautiful breakfast for us featuring indigenous Andean foods.  We would definitely return to Hotel Ecuatresures if our travels take us to Quito again.

direccion: Avenida Naciones Unidas Y Avenida Republica De El Salvador, Quito 170150 Ecuador
descripcion: Sheraton Quito is an excellent choice for travelers visiting Quito, offering a luxury environment alongside many helpful amenities designed to enhance your stay.Guest rooms offer amenities such as a flat screen TV, and guests can go online with free wifi offered by the hotel.Quito Sheraton features room service and a concierge, to help make your stay more enjoyable. The property also boasts a fitness center and breakfast. If you are driving to Sheraton Quito Hotel, free parking is available.Close to some of Quito's most popular landmarks, such as Academia Latinoamericana de Espanol (0.1 mi) and Parque Bicentenario (0.6 mi), Sheraton Quito is a great destination for tourists.Travelers looking to enjoy some shrimp can head to Zazu, ZFood Pescaderia, or Miskay Restaurant. Otherwise, you may want to check out a steakhouse such as San Telmo Bar Restaurante, Chori Gol, or La Concha de la Lora.Quito is also known for some great parks, including Parque Metropolitano, Parque La Carolina, and Parque Itchimbia, which are not too far from Four Points Quito.Enjoy your stay in Quito!

comentarios.p_comentario: מלון 5 כוכבים אמיתי גם בנוחיות וגם בשירות, ארוחת הבוקר הייתה טובה החדר מרווח ומצויד היטב למורת שללא אמצעים להכנת קפה מיטה נוחה מאוד ואפילו ערוץ טלוויזיה האנגלית מיקום מצוין מול מסעדות רבות וליד הפארק והקניון

The hotel is convenient located close to good restaurant and a major shopping center. The staff is really friendly and the service provided is excellent. The lounge food was very good. And all this for a fair price.

The hotel is quiet and the rooms are very comfortable.  I appreciated the bottled water provided in the rooms.  The bilingual (English/Spanish) staff was terrific. When my Spanish speaking husband wasn't available to make requests, I had no difficulty communicating in English with the staff.  The hotel assisted us in getting a bi lingual driver for day trips to Banos, Cotopaxi, and Quilotoa and scheduling larger taxis to accommodate our party of 5 so we wouldn't have to get 2 cabs.  The breakfast buffet was delicious and provided Western and Ecuadorian selections.  Cook's Restaurant was solid--a nice mix of Ecuadorian and Western offerings. Good location near La Carolina Park, just across the street from the shopping mall, bus station was United Nations. No self service on site laundry.…

Excelente lugar. Muy buena atención por parte de todo el personal del hotel las anotaciones confortables. Es un buen lugar para descansar y pasar en pareja y familia reuniones de trabajo.al frenen del hotel queda un centro comercial . recomiendo este hotel de 5 ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Excelente atención, las instalaciones son muy limpias y muy acogedor.  La zona en la que se encuentra el hotel está increible, tienes acceso a muchos restaurantes, centros comerciales y está muy cerca  del Centro Histórico. Fue una agradable experiencia junto con mi familia

muy buen servicio, el personal es muy atento a tu llegada y en toda la estadía. El buffet de desayuno es muy bueno y variado. Me encanto el desayuno del fin de semana. El gym es espectacular, también tiene sauna. La vista es espectacular.

I stayed here for ten days. The staff at the hotel are very helpful and the on-site restaurants good too. I had a nice, spacious room, and whilst it was a little dated, it was quiet for a city centre, clean and cool.

como siempre la mejor, he visitado el hotel por trabajo y con mi familia. son varias las veces que disfrutado solo y ahora en familia, quería que vivieran la majestuosidad, la elegancia de un hotel cinco estrellas en mi pais

I am so glad I stayed here on a recent Quito trip. The location is quite central to anywhere you need to go in the city. Moreover, the neighborhood is quite pleasant and safe to walk around. There are some great restaurants and shops nearby, including the upscale Quicentro Shopping Mall.  The hotel itself was kept quite clean and the staff were always incredibly friendly. I felt welcomed and comfortable asking all my questions. Breakfast was very high quality and something I looked forward to each day. I also enjoyed the spread available in the Club Lounge. My Marriott Status was recognized, and I enjoyed the complimentary welcome gift -- a wine and cheese platter sent to the room!  The room was very clean and a comfortable place to recharge. I was quite pleased with the complimentary water and nice views afforded. My only complaint about the hotel was that the Solarium/Steam Room/Sauna were out of service which was not noted online.  Lastly, the hotel was quite generous and helpful arranging for a late checkout in advance of a very late flight time I had scheduled.…

You feel like you know what you'll get at a Sheraton: comfortable, clean, and great location. You do get that.  But what made the Sheraton at Quito different was the friendly and attentive service. From checkin, the breakfast room, the cleaning staff, and concierge staff, everyone was there to help you feel at home. I hope to go back again one day soon.

direccion: Juan Rodríguez E8-20 y Diego de Almagro, Quito 170103 Ecuador
descripcion: The french style Boutique Hotel Antinea, is a first class hotel in Quito made of 2 beautiful houses declared Cultural Heritage of Quito and located in the most charming street of Quito. The rooms, suites and apartments are unique, each one with a charming and special decoration, whit access to private terrases or flowered gardens and patios. We are proud of receiving regularly artists, painters, writers whom have chosen the hotel for its charming atmosphere, its quietness and the kindness of the staff. If you are planning on staying for a while, our furnished apartments are a perfect choice for your extended stay in Quito. We also offer a variety of services such as transfer to or from the Airport, SPA massages, therapeutic massages and tours in Quito and in other ecuadorian regions. We hope to see you very soon!

comentarios.p_comentario: The host Veronica  was amaziing. She was friendly, attentive and helpful . She arranged  safe transport from the airporr to the hotel- the driver was , Edison, was great. .  Veronica's English is impeccable. She promptly answered all my questions before my visit.  Bteskfast is served in a  dining  area that i loved.  Definitely try the yogurt! Throughout the hotel  the decor is unigue..  The room was comfortable and clean. There are several garden areas that are pleasant for relaxing or work.   All staff I had the pleasure of having contact with were professional and friendly.  If I return to quito, this is where I will stay.  The location is great.

I absolutely loved staying in this cute, super clean, cosy boutique hotel. Veronica was absolutely amazing. Super kind and accommodating. I felt like I was very well attended at all times.  I had a great experience and I highly recommend it!

L’établissement est très agréable, plein de charme et joliment décoré. Le personnel est aimable et disponible. La rue est très bien, les alentours un peu dégradé depuis la COVID  qui a entraîné la fermeture de beaucoup d’établissement. Néanmoins il persiste quelques bons restaurants et belles boutiques. Excellente adresse à Quito.

I would absolutely recommend this lovely boutique hotel. In an attractive, safe, quiet street, but just a steps away from shops and restaurants. The hotel and rooms are full of character, interesting and beautifully decorated. The beds are comfortable, the rooms are individually furnished and very clean. We booked a basic double room, which far surpassed our expectations and had a lovely little balcony. The hotel is beautifully furnished, with little sitting rooms where you can relax, as well as a pretty courtyard. Good wifi and a very helpful, professional young lady in charge, who spoke fluent English and communicated with us, prior to our arrival and soon after booking. Nice breakfast of eggs, fruit, croissants, juice and coffee, served in an attractive breakfast room. Parking was in their garage, completely secure. Loved this hotel so much, that we stopped there twice more during our travels in Ecuador.…

I brought a group of nine people down to Quito to climb Cotopaxi. And from the very beginning while planning this trip, Veronica was amazing. We must have exchanged 30 or 40 emails. And she was so prompt in answering all of our questions. We stayed for five nights then left to climb the mountain they came back for another couple of nights. You can imagine all the questions that this number of a group would have. I don't see how she managed to take care of all of us arranging tour shuttles rides etc. It seems like she never slept. I'm going to give this hotel my highest rating ever but it's 100% due to Veronica. From scheduling covid test in the hotel to shuttles back and forth all over the place, she never missed a beat and was always smiling. This is probably the best experience I've had with any hotel ever. Thank you Veronica for taking care of this Tennessee group. We will definitely be back.…

Room was very comfortable. Veronica served up a great breakfast and was very helpful with other information. The other meals were also good. The place is oozing charm in every corner. Could not ask for more character. The place is older so is starting to show it's age. It needs a little bit of maintenance and TLC.

very unfriendly welcome (kids felt the same; either they had no experience anymore with clients or did not want to see clients); rooms outdated; not clean (blood on the bed linen, very old blankets); we had no towels in the room and when I went down to ask for towels while my wife was waiting freezing after her shower, I was challenged twice about the fact that there were towels in the room; breakfast was a joke (2 croissants for 4, no toast/bread, not even a plate (we had to eat in the small plate under the coffee cup), not even a juice, we had to ask for 3 refill of marmalade as we only got a tiny portion for 4 people (as if this was safran)….). A very poor experience. Location was maybe good, but this does not compensate for the poor experience. Fortunately, was only for one night.…

My wife and I recently spent two weeks in a lovely one bedroom apartment (with bathroom, kitchen, living room, and pleasant outdoor balcony-patio) here at Antinea.  It was my second visit to this extraordinary boutique hotel and I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Quito.  Veronica, who oversees the hotel is as friendly and helpful as any hotel manager I have ever encountered.  The hotel is exceptional in many ways, and each room has its own design, feel, and distinctive quality.  The breakfasts are delicious and the room service splendid.  It is located on one of the most beautiful streets in Mariscal Sucre because of the gorgeous old trees that line the sidewalk.  It is conveniently located near dozens of quality eating establishments and markets.  I cannot recommend Antinea strongly enough.…

This hotel was located in a perfect location for exploring. It is decorated adorable and truly made me feel the South American vibe. The front desk arranged a driver to pick us up from the airport as we were getting in very late. We wound up using the same driver (Renee who was so sweet and such a safe driver) to take us to Banos. We stayed here for 3 days. The weather was not great so we were sad we could not take advantage of the beautiful balcony more. If you are looking for a quaint spot in Quito down a quiet tree lined street, still close to the action, this is it.

My vacation in Quito Ecuador was enhanced with my stay at Hotel Antinea. The reception by Veronica was warm, friendly and helpful. The rooms are magnificent. European style. All my needs were met. Veronica created delicious breakfasts each of the 5 mornings during my visit. She is an excellent cook and host. Veronica was helpful with suggestions of places to explore around the city and country. I recommend the Antinea highly. You won't be disappointed.. Thank you Veronica and staff.

nombre_id: Holiday Inn Quito Airport, an IHG Hotel
direccion: Solar Numero 4 Barrio Santa Rosa, Parroquia Tababela, Calle Conector, Quito 0 Ecuador
descripcion: Welcome to Holiday Inn Quito Airport! Conveniently located just 5 minutes from Quito Mariscal Sucre International Airport, and 30 minutes from the north of the city, where the main corporate offices and the biggest shopping centers are located. We offer free shuttle service 24/7 from and to the Airport and a safe private taxi service.

comentarios.nombreh_id: Holiday Inn Quito Airport, an IHG Hotel
comentarios.p_comentario: Excelente ambiente y decoración, cenando junto a la piscina, la iluminación adecuada, la música en vivo muy buena, la bebida de cortesía exquisita a base de fernet. Felicitaciones Holliday. Espero volver pronto.

comentarios.nombreh_id: Holiday Inn Quito Airport, an IHG Hotel
comentarios.p_comentario: What a beautiful room.  So nice, and so close to the airport, which is excellent.  Staff was very friendly.  Also, the restaurant had a great variety of food, and it was so delicious!  I wish we could have spent more time there.  It was rich looking and so beautiful.  The room was so clean and beautiful!  Very elegant!  I would highly recommend this hotel.  Free airport shuttle service really helped us.  I highly recommend staying here!  So very nice!  Staff were very helpful!!!.

comentarios.nombreh_id: Holiday Inn Quito Airport, an IHG Hotel
comentarios.p_comentario: Best Holiday Inn I have ever stayed at.The service and staff were exceptional and most could speak English..for us U.S. snobs..lol Their work ethic is incredible.So clean.They have everything you need.So relaxing.It does have mountain views and perfect location near airport.Has room service too.For people from the states,you can't beat the price for everything they have.I booked a room just because I had a long layover..so worth it.

comentarios.nombreh_id: Holiday Inn Quito Airport, an IHG Hotel
comentarios.p_comentario: I've traveled the world and this is by far my favorite Holiday Inn property and one of the tops in hotels anywhere. The staff is wonderful, the rooms clean cool and spacious and there's a top notch restaurant. When plans went awry we regrouped and recharged here. A great location also!

comentarios.nombreh_id: Holiday Inn Quito Airport, an IHG Hotel
comentarios.p_comentario: My husband and I staid here on July 5-6, 2022. Besides having all the amenities listed - pool, hot tab, exercise room, etc.- we were given a great room. The service was impeccable, the staff very attentive and the cleanliness as well, even better than the Holiday Inns we have been in in the US. In addition, there were hand sanitizer stations all over the building and most of the staff wore masks. Which is true of most Ecuador, by the way. Being located five minutes shuttle drive from the airport, it's also a great choice for those that are going on to the Galapagos or other destinations. I have no reservations recommending this hotel.

comentarios.nombreh_id: Holiday Inn Quito Airport, an IHG Hotel
comentarios.p_comentario: This was by far the worst hotel experience I have had. Line to check in didnt seem bad but was about 4-5 people ahead of me. Waited over an hour somehow. It appeared front desk did not know what they were doing. We got up to desk and there was alot of whispering and come to find out they didnt have a room available for us. Asked if we just booked that day. I had confirmation of reservation over 2 months ago. Told us to step aside and wait. By this time it was 9 pm and my 2 kids were loosing it. Had hoped to go to pool after long day of travel. After about 30 min we had to walk back to the front desk to see if any progress had been made. A lady offered us food which I knew ment they did not have an answer. Waited another 15 min and a guy came out to again ask if we just made reservation. I said no and showed him paper work. He said well we dont have a room available and tried to move us to another hotel. By this time its almost 10pm and my 6 year old is asleep on the cough in the lobby while my 8 year old is having a melt down. I told them no to find a room. By this time the line for check in was about 20 people deep so i know they were giving someone a room. Waited another 15-20 min and had to go back up to front desk since no one was coming back to give us any answers and my husband by this time was stern they give us a room. Finally after over 3 hours since we had arrived we got a room.   Pros: room was clean and breakfast was good…

comentarios.nombreh_id: Holiday Inn Quito Airport, an IHG Hotel
comentarios.p_comentario: We were supposed to stay in downtown Quito for two nights before our cruise but because of protests, we were put up at this hotel. We were concerned how we would spend two nights in an airport hotel, but we were so pleasantly surprised. The rooms were brand new, spotless, and spacious. The hotel pool provided lots of entertainment for the kids. The buffet breakfasts and lunch were totally fine and had good options.  The bartender made great drinks.

comentarios.nombreh_id: Holiday Inn Quito Airport, an IHG Hotel
comentarios.p_comentario: The hotel has lovely comfy room but the food here is absolutely shocking , a mixed salad consisted of 2 lettuce leaves , my medium well steak was still breathing  and this picture is the only bit of my cold coffee I ordered I got to drink, not sure how they can even charge you for a mouthful or where the rest went

comentarios.nombreh_id: Holiday Inn Quito Airport, an IHG Hotel
comentarios.p_comentario: This has to be one of the cleanest hotels we’ve stayed in!! The hotel is fairly new, our room was huge with wood floors (which I prefer) and the toiletries were nice. The staff were very helpful and theres coffee and small pastries if you have to leave early. Would highly recommend you stay here.

comentarios.nombreh_id: Holiday Inn Quito Airport, an IHG Hotel
comentarios.p_comentario: Wonderful hotel.  This has to be the cleanest hotel I had ever seen.  The floors are hardwood so no stained carpet.  The shuttle was very prompt when we cleared customs.  The driver was also very friendly.  The breakfast buffet was also amazing.  Would recommend this hotel.

nombre_id: La Casona de La Ronda Heritage Boutique Hotel
direccion: Calle Morales OE1 160 Centro Historico, Quito 170104 Ecuador
descripcion: Super location, easy access, in the heart of the Historic and Colonial Center, walking distance (5 minutes) to many main attractions. The hotel is located in “La Ronda” street; a narrow, lively pedestrian street full of character with many restaurants, bars and folk stores making it a unique neighborhood that is a ‘must do’ on your visit list. La Casona de la Ronda is a delightful, authentic Spanish Colonial style boutique hotel with a gentle, calming feel built in an old 1738 Mansion. The rooms are attractively decorated beyond your expectations featuring hand carved furniture by local master craftsmen, polished fine wood flooring, spacious and comfortable with a deluge shower in the bathroom. Even though it is an old “La Casona” we offer modern services: • WiFi at no charge • Reception 24 hours, tour bookings available • Full service restaurant; buffet breakfast, a la carte lunch and dinner, room service available • Transportation to/from the airport upon request.

comentarios.nombreh_id: La Casona de La Ronda Heritage Boutique Hotel
comentarios.p_comentario: Ok: so Quito itself is a bit odd. Mix of "lovely old colonial city", and "you might get robbed at any second". I don't know if that latter part is true, or just something people warn tourists about endlessly. Ended up taking taxis everywhere as a result (the hotel will walk you to and from them, without expecting a tip). Taxi's are super cheap, so the only downside really is not being able to walk around as you would normally feel safe to do in a major city centre.  Hotel? Lovely old building, super friendly staff + guests. Enjoyed dinner there twice - wine choice in restaurant was weirdly limited given they have lovely bottles in reception, but the food was nice. Breakfast buffet pretty mediocre to be honest, but dinner and lunch were good.   Free filtered water, nice big towels, comfy bed, free masks + slippers, etc, big rooms, etc - all nice from accommodation point of view. Nice idea of tea + coffee downstairs at 4pm, which got people talking if you want to make some new friends. Spoke to a few interesting folks.  Other things we did: - walking tour of old town (great) - cable car (enjoyed that, but brace for high altitude). We walked a few hundred metres to the swings at the top, and that was enough. Views are good - did a bit of shopping. If you're loaded/happy to spend a lot, Gallery Latina has nice stuff. We found it overpriced, so went to some shops nearby and got similar things for less £ - ate at Zazu for a multi-course dinner, superb  The yellow cabs all over the city are cheap + easy to get, or you can call an Uber simply enough when away from the hotel.…

comentarios.nombreh_id: La Casona de La Ronda Heritage Boutique Hotel
