comentarios.p_comentario: Chose this hotel for its proximity to the old town and the reviews and photos from previous guests. All were accurate ! We were warmly welcomed by Aaron and staff. We also used Alex their preferred driver to see Quito and surrounds. Very happy time!

comentarios.nombreh_id: La Casona de La Ronda Heritage Boutique Hotel
comentarios.p_comentario: This place is gorgeous and you can walk everywhere in Old Town. The courtyard is phenomenal. The rooms are newly renovated quiet and clean. We would definitely recommend this place to anyone wishing to stay in the Old part of the city. Very secure as well and we felt very safe. They will also store your bags for you before/ after check out

comentarios.nombreh_id: La Casona de La Ronda Heritage Boutique Hotel
comentarios.p_comentario: We had a great stay at La Casona. It is located very near the historic parts of the city and has the charm and uniqueness of a good boutique hotel. Rooms were spacious and comfortable and service was great - down to booking taxis and arranging for escorts to restaurants if you’re walking. We also found the breakfast good - and appreciated the local additions to the buffet which most other hotels we’ve stayed at haven’t really done.   A good option all round.

comentarios.nombreh_id: La Casona de La Ronda Heritage Boutique Hotel
comentarios.p_comentario: We have had the privilege of staying here for a little over a week. The staff here are fantastic and are very keen to help with any requirements. Daniel at the reception is the most helpful hotelier I have ever come across.  We stayed in the apartments that are about 100 meters from the main hotel. These are very modern clean and comfortable with everything one needs, dishwasher, washing machine, dryer and big screen TV.  The food from the restaurant is absolutely incredible, we ordered to our apartment on a number of occasions giving the feeling we were eating a chef quality meal in our own home.

comentarios.nombreh_id: La Casona de La Ronda Heritage Boutique Hotel
comentarios.p_comentario: This was our first stop in our journey round Ecuador & the Galapagos. it was a lovely hotel with very helpful and friendly staff. The breakfast buffet  was excellent for such a relatively small hotel, and the food at dinner was also good.  Comfortable room which was on the front and there was a lot of noise on the Saturday evening - we had to keep windows shut which was fine as it wasn'ttoo hot, but could have been a problem in better weather. Definitely a good base for exploring Quito.

comentarios.nombreh_id: La Casona de La Ronda Heritage Boutique Hotel
comentarios.p_comentario: This hotel is in a quiet street at the edge of the old town. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The hotel is gorgeous inside with plants everywhere. The staff are all really friendly and welcoming. They have drivers you can book to take you to and from the airport or to take you around Quito. They are very nice and reliable. We ate there one evening and had a very good meal. They make a super Pisco Sour! If we were going to Quito again we would definitely stay there.

comentarios.nombreh_id: La Casona de La Ronda Heritage Boutique Hotel
comentarios.p_comentario: We stayed at La Casona de La Ronda before and after our trip to Galapagos.  Our rooms were wonderful - spacious, comfortable.  The hotel is in a very good location, is historic and beautifully decorated, has very comfortable lounge area, afternoon treats/coffee/tea, delicious breakfast.  The website pictures are truthful.  We felt very welcomed and well taken care of.  The restaurant was fabulous, affordable and had many offerings.  We particularly liked the potato soup.  Even when we were sitting in the hotel lobby having a drink and playing cards, we were able to order from the restaurant menu.  Very accommodating and highly recommended.

comentarios.nombreh_id: La Casona de La Ronda Heritage Boutique Hotel
comentarios.p_comentario: Ein sehr zentral gelegenes Hotel mitten in der Altstadt. Die Zimmer sind groß und die Badezimmer sehr schön. In unsere m ersten Zimmer funktionierte die Mischbatterien der Dusche nicht. Immer kochendes Wasser. Das Frühstück ist gut. Einzig die Lautstärke  dr umgebenden Restaurants würde uns von einem erneuten Besuch abhalten. Da helfen auch die Schallschutzfenster nicht.

comentarios.nombreh_id: La Casona de La Ronda Heritage Boutique Hotel
comentarios.p_comentario: We selected this hotel for its look and mix of service and comfort all of which were delivered. I want to comment particularly on the reception service which we experienced as extraordinary.   We had one of those ‘out of the blue’ medical issues - the unexpected recurrence of a problem which we knew to be serious and potentially requiring a return to the U.K. Huge kudos to our consultant in the U.K. she recognised instantly both the urgency but also suggested the next step and emailed us what was required. The challenge we then had was finding an Ecuadorean doctor prepared to consult on the reference and then obtaining and fulfilling the prescription. If I tell you that we started off consulting our U.K. consultant at 7 am and left the hotel to sightsee at 11 am with the prescription fulfilled you’ll appreciate the extraordinary job done by the reception staff. And if I tell you also that this job was concluded with the receptionist himself going to the pharmacy to get our prescription you’ll understand just exactly how much care was taken to ensure everything finished well.…

direccion: Av 12 de Octubre 1820 & Luis Cordero La Floresta Zone, Quito 1721565 Ecuador
descripcion: Swissotel Quito is a luxury hotel conveniently located in the commercial and residential area of Quito. The hotel is within easy access to the Old Town and to the airport. Known as the kindest hotel of Latin America, Swissotel Quito is recognised for the finest service in the city. Four excellent restaurants offer a wide variety of international cuisine. From Mediterranean, Japanese and sumptuous buffets, there is menu to suit every taste at Swissôtel Quito. The hotel’s Amrita Spa is the perfect place for relaxation or lively workout. Facilities include an indoor and outdoor swimming pool, sauna, steam bath, fitness centre, squash, and racquet and tennis courts. Swissotel Quito offers the largest and most modern convention centre in the city.

comentarios.p_comentario: A good one night stay , very comfortable hotel , staff are all very friendly and helpful. Rooms are spacious , bed is enormous but only 4 pillows . Only one pack of creama in the room sure we could have got more but only realised when we needed it .  Gym is excellent and well laid out

Un verdadero hotel de 5 estrellas, que destila elegancia y buen hacer en cada detalle. Se ha convertido en mi referente en Quito. Los restaurantes de primer nivel, y el room service muy completo y precios razonables. Habitación muy cómoda, totalmente recomendado. Wifi muy rápido.

I loved this hotel. The hotel staff was pleasant to deal with always courteous and friendly. I felt very safe and comfortable at all times. The food was delicious and always fresh. I trusted the cleaning staff when they came every day to freshen up my room.  I would recommend this hotel for your next visit to Quito. Centrally located near good restaurants.

Nice and comfortable place. The Hotel is close to many great restaurants.  Service is excellent and people very friendly.  The pool rea is very nice and there are a couple of restaurants within the same building that are excellent.

Cada vez que voy a Quito tengo mal de altura, en esta ocasión no ha sido differente. Lo que ha marcado la diferencia ha sido la profesionalidad y buen hacer del gerente nocturno Gabriel Marquez que me facilitó te de coca para sobrellevar el soroche. Además cada día se preocupaba por mi estado de salud. Muy agradecido.

Sin novedades en el hospedaje check in demorado check out rápido, desayuno buffet incluído bueno, habitación en 7mo piso sin ruido, limpia, la ordenaron a demanda,cama confortable, baño limpio, una cafetera para express free

El Swissotel de Quito es un magnifico lugar para descansar, está muy bien situado, y el restaurante sirven un poderoso desayuno variado y co platos típicos de la cultura ecuatoriana. Habitaciones amplias, y buena vista. La zona tiene cerca restaurantes, y lugares de ocio.

Amabilidad del personal, la comida es deliciosa. Muy buena ubicación y están atentos a cada detalle. El hotel Se encuentra bien mantenido, hay mucho cuidado en los detalles. La limpieza es excelente.  Muy recomendó excelente ubicación..

O hotel é lindíssimo, quartos grandes e um atendimento excelente. Minha única reclamação é sobre o check in às 15hs, sai do Brasil as 20h, cheguei no hotel as 09:30 e tive de ficar aguardando até a 13hs, isso porque fui perguntar se o quarto esta disponível, se não teria ficado aguardando até as 15h. o Café da manhã é excelente muita variedades.

Instalaciones, ubicación y comodidad, agradable comida, personal amable y buen lugar para negocios y descanso, recomiendo sus habitaciones y la amabilidad del personal. Costo beneficio proporcional a la comodidad y elegancia de las habitaciones

direccion: Ramon Roca E 4-122 Av. Amazonas, Quito 170150 Ecuador
descripcion: The Mercure ALAMEDA Hotel, located in the heart of Quito, is the best place to stay and discover the wonders offered by this city, which is a World Heritage center. We have a variety of rooms for family and corporate events to satisfy all your needs. They are equipped with the latest in technology, which will ensure that your meeting is a success. We have now available the new Cipreses Mercure Ballroom Theater, the only one of its kind in Quito, with a capacity for 320 people. At the Spicy Bistro restaurant, you will find a world that will surprise you with an exquisite national and international cuisine. And to enjoy a delicious cocktail or glass of wine, we offer the GlobeWalker & Winebar, with a wine list selected by an exclusive tasting that the MERCURE Hotel Alameda. holds every year. We also offer our informal hanging-out spaces such as the Alameda Q, where a good coffee or a delicious appetizer are always available. Of course, our Bakery serves you the best cakes and pastries, which are ideal for take-out. At ALAMEDA Hotel Mercure, you will always have the guarantee of good service and excellent quality.

comentarios.p_comentario: Was recommended by our travel agent.  The hotel was excellent.  From the room to the food. Awesome breakfast.  Staff gave us great service and guidance.  Had "smaller" breakfast ready at 4 for all of us with early flights. Highly recommend.

Stayed here before and after a jungle trip. Nice. Centrally located. Clean. Felt safe as a solo. Spicy, the restaurant did breakfast well and their chicken stew was delightful. The reception area was tasteful and the staff did a great job with luggage, etc. I would stay again.

Let me preface that we came with Gate 1 tour group   Location: located in the heart of the city. We were there on a holiday so not a lot of shops open or people . Lots of graffiti around us though. We were told not to walk around at night.  Food: we just had breakfast which was a buffet but the quality and taste were poor. They had runny scrambled eggs, little sausages, local rice and stew, some fresh fruit. Coffee was from a machine and not great. Because breakfast was so bad we didn’t try any other meals. There was a bar that looked decent.  Service: staff seemed friendly enough. But don’t let the guy out front get you a “taxi” he charges more. Have the front desk call one that has a meter. There’s no rideshare. They use US dollars and a ready can get you most places for $2-3  Accommodations: equivalent to a 3 star or Embassy suites in the US . Even as a couple most rooms are twin beds. Tiny bathroom with thin hard towels. A tiny shampoo and conditioner and soap that don’t lather. Bring your own. Beds were ok. There is a Hair dryer in the bathroom. Plugs were compatible to US. The internet was also decent.…

J’ai adoré l’espace détente avec petite piscine, jacuzzi, sauna et hammam. Comme le reste de l’hôtel c’est un peu daté mais bien agréable quand même. Petit déjeuner bien garni. Petit bémol sur le quartier qui n’est vraiment pas intéressant, c’est très compliqué de trouver à manger le soir, et rejoindre la vieille ville à pied est impossible, c’est bien trop loin et dangereux paraît-il.

The location was great.  The staff was eager to please and accommodate.  No heating or air conditioning, so was very cold in the room, but they brought a heater in to help.  2 separate rooms in our room, living room was kind of empty.  Very clean.  Not far from the main street to walk up and down on.  I liked staying here a lot!!!  Breakfast was inclued!!

Very nice hotel, we had a great stay!  The room was nice and clean.  Not much lighting, and no climate control - but totally fine!  Breakfast buffet was very nice with lots of choices and fresh baked goods and good coffee!  All in all it was a good stay.  There is a small convenience store across the street which is handy.

We had emailed the hotel ahead to ask for a quiet room and we were delighted with the one allocated and the special touches left to mark our ruby wedding anniversary.  We were there 4 nights. We ate in the restaurant  and were pleased with the scope of the menu from sandwiches to fine dining. The breakfast buffet was outstanding  in variety and quantity and you could order omelettes or eggs cooked to order.  Do not hesitate to stay here if in Quito. Though speaking a little spanish certainly helps.

Ecuador, famous particularly for three things, the Equator Line, the Amazon and Galápagos Islands. An annoying one stop flight from Cusco (City in neighbouring Perù) to Quito followed by an hour long transfer from the airport found us in the new part of Quito's City Centre. Our itinerary meant that we would staying twice at the Mercure Alameda Quito.   Our rooms were both very, very comfortable with a king sized bed, entrance hall, plenty of storage/wardrobe space and a three piece bathroom set. The second room had a lounge that had a greater square footage than my own home; finished off with a balcony that overlooked the intersection, Ideal for exploring Quito.   Service at the hotel exceptionally good with staff members still following Covid-19 rules. The hotel restaurant served a variety of dishes that on the face of it seemed familiar but were executed with a South American twist. An additional spice here and there or a vegetable better known in the Caribbean than in Europe ensured that  the word insipid couldn't be used in the same sentence. The restaurant is certainly value for money.   The rooftop spa and fitness rooms are health club standard with a great panoramic view of the city.   Visiting the old town can be achieved by taxi, roughly $3 to £5 USD, or by a twenty-something minute walk. However you travel to the old town make sure that you give it a try. The Spanish influence is ever present again with a Latin American twist that is very aesthetically pleasing.   The Middle of the World City is about an hours drive from the hotel and surely is part of any visitor's plans.   Overall a great hotel that is highly recommended. …

Lovely hotel, staff were very helpful and friendly. The covid safeguards were excellent.  Restaurant was very good. It is a good place to stay in the city we felt safe and comfortable.  The rooms were clean and well maintained.  We used the hotel taxi a couple of times and the driver was very helpful

We had a great room at this hotel. It was a nice two room suite.  It could have used climate control but really that was our only complaint.  The staff was very nice and the breakfast was outstanding.  The location was pretty good as well.  They had a nice coffee shop on the ground level too.

direccion: Tamayo N23-95 y Wilson, Quito 170150 Ecuador
descripcion: It is our pleasure to present Ikala Quito Hotel, a project inspired by the history, culture and regions of our beautiful country: Ecuador. Located in the Mariscal neighborhood of Ecuador ́s vibrant capital city, the Ikala Quito Hotel accounts with 44 rooms that have been designed to meet the needs of our esteemed guests. The Hotel is comprised of three homes that were once colonial style houses of aristocratic families of the neighborhood and were renovated to offer our guests a comfortable stay and personalized service.

comentarios.p_comentario: Houve um equívoco na nossa reserva e tivemos que dormir a primeira noite num quarto twin, mas no dia seguinte os próprios funcionários transferiram nossas malas para um quarto de casal e deram um upgrade de quarto para a gente na ala nova. A ala velha do hotel tem banheiros ruins e com problema no chuveiro, a temperatura oscila e você se queima ou toma banho gelado. não consegue estabilizar a temperatura. Os funcionários são Muito atenciosos.

The Ikala hotel was perfect for us. The room was gorgeous and clean, very cool decorations throught the room and hotel. I was really impressed. The staff was awesome, super friendly and helpful. The restaurant was pretty good too, and there are a lot of restaurants to try nearby. Quito was an incredible city to visit. We hope to come back again someday. I highly recommend staying at Ikala and visiting Ecuador!

The hotel was very good and clean. The breakfast was good. The location exlant. The hotel staff were very kind and did everything to help. We enjoy staying in the hotel and most recommend to book in this nice and cosy hotel. Thank a lot Ikala staff 💐

Les chambres sont petites mais très confortables. Bonne literie, salle de bain avec savon, glace grossissante. Si pas de sèche cheveux le demander à l'accueil. Dans chaque chambre, une carafe d'eau filtrée. Il est possible de remplir gourde ou bouteille d'eau au distributeur qui se trouve au restaurant. Nous n'avons pas eu de problème d'eau chaude. Petit déjeuner, simple mais très correct sous forme de buffet. A voir au 3ème étage une terrasse avec vue panoramique. Une bonne adresse pour un petit hôtel.

Voyage en famille en Équateur, 7 personnes, donc plusieurs chambres. La partie "Ancienne" de l’hôtel est un peu moins confortable mais les chambres rénovées sont très bien. Très bon petit déjeuner, très copieux, personnel à l'écoute, le lieu est calme et très propre. Un excellent rapport qualité prix. 3 nuits au total dans l'hôtel.

Unfortunately,  we only stayed at this hotel for one night as it was only to take our flight back to the USA the next day.  I was impressed with this hotel.  It is beautiful and the service was very good.  Our room was pretty big with a balcony, windows (including in the bathroom) that had amazing views.  The hotel is located in the Mariscal area which is the place you want to be if you want a bit of the night life in Quito.   It was walking distance to restaurants, bars, the plaza artesanal and Plaza Foch.  My friends' room was also beautiful and very specious and they liked it very much but they claimed it was next to a restaurant bar in the next building and that it was a bit loud late at night.  I did not have that experience personally as our room was very quiet and we had a great restful  last night in Ecuador.  If you go, just make sure they give you a room on the other side to makes sure is quite, unless you will be up partying with them next door lol…

In accordance with our travel itinerary, we spent 2+1 = a total of 3 nights there and we were very satisfied with the two rooms as well as the selection and high quality of food provided for breakfast. Rooms were spacious and clean. Breakfast: Concerning the warm food, there was even some variation across days with bites wrapped in leaves on one occasion. Scrambled eggs were yellow and white, which means they don't come from a tetrapak like nowadays is often the case - at least in Europe.

It was the end of my 3 week work/vacation trip in Ecuador and I wanted a place I could relax and rest before the long travel back to US. They also organized someone to come to hotel and give me a COVID test which was so helpful as well as a taxi at 3am o the airport.

Cet hotel avait été choisi par notre agence de voyage. Nous avons été très déçu. La télévision ne marchait pas, la chasse d’eau fonctionnait par intermittence et pas d’eau chaude du tout! L’hôtel avait un problème d’eau chaude mais n’avait rien dit….

We had 2 rooms, one for a couple which was ok but the door was not closed completely, the other was for one person.  In the single person room the shower was broken!!! It makes me wonder why wasn’t it found by the cleaner. This room was also very noisy ( from the street). The rooms are very small, and very old.  However the reception were very cooperative and tried to assist in everything they could. Location is good as well.

direccion: Barrio Rumipamba Aloag Provincia Pichincha, Quito 170150 Ecuador
descripcion: Hacienda La Alegria is a family horse hacienda in the heart of Ecuador's "Avenue of the Volcanoes". We are situated one hour south of the historic colonial city of Quito, the capital of Ecuador. One hour to Cotopaxi National park. One hour to Saquisili Market. Two hours to Quilotoa crater lake. Pasochoa Volcano, Corazon, Viudita and Illinizas volcanoes on the area. One hour to Quito Airport. Explore the dairy operation, milking cows, feeding calves, petting our 4 border collies, Aging cheese cave, 24llamas alpacas and vicuna, rabbits, guinea pig, rose garden, hacienda garden with orchids and old trees, hot tub, two fire place living rooms, wall climbing, fishing trout, making bread, pizza or BBQ at the wood oven, the 9 volcanoes at the valley, enjoy the Cotopaxi with his vapor fumes in the back of Ruminahui Volcano in front of the hacienda. The rooms are beautiful and spacious with a picture perfect view of the country side. Now also available a suite. The food, wine, the beer and cheese are delicious and plentiful. We plan to produce our own cheese with the 1500 liters of milk per day, from our 240 cattle. Learn to Ride, groom, pet, feed, shoe, educate and enjoy our 90 horses. We breed horses and for next year we plan to have 20 new foals. Enjoy the voulting experience, 3 different arenas to start riding or learn, try the wood polo horse, the chagra demonstration, riding games as the Sortijas or Cintas. Choose the multi day rides from one day to 12 day ride at the Andes. All of this makes Hacienda La Alegria a family destiny and a life time experience. The mission of Hacienda la Alegria is to provide high quality horseback riding and eco-tourism adventure along the highest trails of the Volcano avenue at the Ecuadorian Andes, assuring personalized attention and hospitality "

comentarios.p_comentario: Gabriel and Patty, assisted by Mauricio and the team run a friendly and professional hacienda and horse riding centre. We stayed for 8 days and wished we could have been there longer! The accommodation and food was excellent but the real stars of the show are the horses that Gabriel has bred and trained. We had rides into the cloud forest and up to Cotopaxi volcano. Breath- taking views and experiences! They have a horse suited to everyone’s experience. Our hosts couldn’t do enough to make our holiday as enjoyable as possible. Thoroughly recommended!!

I planned to stay 2-3 weeks but left after 3 days. I cannot understand why this place is highly rated. I've traveled extensively and cannot think of another experience which compares. I have NEVER felt this unsafe.  I felt unsafe with and bullied by Mauri. On our first ride together (alone), dogs attacked my horse (not barked at, ATTACKED). He never even turned around to look at me, let alone attempt to assist me in any way. When I regained control of my frightened, kicking horse and evaded the dogs, I told him I felt unsafe with him and wanted to return to the Hacienda. He didn't want to. ”They’re dogs,” he said, “what do you want me to do about it?” In that moment, I decided to cut my stay short. I insisted we return to the Hacienda. We were 20 min into our ride. I asked if we were returning every 15-20 min, for an hour. "Do you feel better now?" He asked after almost an hour and a half. I suspect he ignored my request to return hoping I'd forget the incident. This made me so uncomfortable.  At the Hacienda, I told Mauri I planned to leave within the next few days. He angrily demanded to know why - though I’d already told him — and dismissively waved his hands in my face when I responded.  Mauri seemed, multiple times over the course of that day and the following day, to “forget” I wanted to leave.  He claimed he called the taxi — I asked that afternoon and 4x the following day. When I asked for the final time, in the evening, he said "so you're REALLY leaving?"  I said yes. He said he had not received a response. "What should we do if they don't respond?" I asked. "Yeah well I don't know," he said, and glared at me in silence. Luckily I found the phone number and sent a WhatsApp message; they responded in five minutes! I arranged the taxi myself. I am traveling alone; I was so disturbed by this. If I want to leave, the hotel is supposed to help me arrange transportation; I felt held hostage. I realize this sounds insane; it felt insane living it in the moment.  Backtracking: on my first day there, Mauri commented on my tattoos and told me I should “stop getting them.” He told me about another client — a tattooed American woman who got into the jacuzzi “in a tiny little bikini so you could see everything.” I thought this was inappropriate and it made me uncomfortable. I shrugged it off; I traveled so far to get here and had high hopes.  Mauri gave me three different horses in my 2 days of riding. The first reared when spooking. Another bolted in the paddock and bucked several times when I slowed him. I was told “these are horses for experienced riders” in a tone that implied I somehow asked for this by saying I was experienced, and should “handle it.” I did, but this was jarring and not the experience I wanted or expected when I booked my trip here.  No one ever assessed my riding ability.  On my second day, I witnessed a small child fall off her horse and almost get trampled. Mauri blamed her for “not controlling her horse” (she was 8 and a first time rider) and then laughed.  Gabriel called me on my last morning to ask why I was leaving. I told him I felt unsafe with Mauri's behavior and comments. He said “yeah well he (Mauri) is getting old.”  I would not recommend this location. Bucking and rearing horses are not “advanced” horses, they’re liabilities. The good horse I rode, Moonshine, was bitless because of a bad tooth — this calls for vet care. I saw another horse with a badly infected leg. One of the employees told me the lame horses were given to children.  All the trails at Alegria are on cobbled roads — and so is 90% of the cantering — unsafe for rider and bad for the horse.…

Traveling isn’t always such a rewarding experience. Staying  at Hacienda Alegria is. Patty and Gabriel are such perfect hosts. One feels so totally at ease at this tranquil and elegant Hacienda . The friendly  but unpretentious  atmosphere captures one immediately. We decided to choose La Alegria to join Gabriel to a two day ride through the Cloud Forest. The first day you ride out to the premises around the Hacienda to pep up your ride abilities and of course to test if the horse and the saddle you are using are the right ones. In the afternoon you are asked to join to get to know the Hacienda, so you watch the cow milking process, you visit the mares and their ponies and you enjoy the tranquil surroundings. Food at La Alegria is delicious and Patty makes sure to look out for all your dietary requirements. The riding adventure started the next day. It was a real extraordinary experience. Gabriel and his wonderful team, including the patient and wonderful horses took us through a route where we could enjoy the espectacular scenery that started at 2800 mts over the mountains  to a 3500 mts pass and then slowly descended to a totally different biosphere where giant farms, luscious plants and trees and thousands of orchids. Because humidity is high you are surrounded by a misty light fog that makes you feel like riding on clouds. This was a very special ride!  …

I stayed 2 nights at Hacienda La Alegria, conveniently located about 1 hour south of Quito.  This is a beautiful old hacienda, with a newer addition that blends in seamlessly where the guest area is located.  La Alegria is mostly known for their horse riding vacations, with 100+ horses on the farm.  They are also a working dairy farm.  I did a lovely horse ride thru the scenic countryside and cobblestone paths.  Mauricio, who helps out with the guests, was an excellent host and spoke very good English.  I was interested in the local culture, and Mauricio took the time to drive me into town and around the farm.  The guest rooms are large, well appointed, and have nice views.  There is also a comfortable living room and deck area.  Meals are good and served at an agreed upon time.

I had the pleasure of staying 11 days at Alegria and doing the cloud forest and quilotoa rides with Gabriel! The food, hosts, staff and horses are all top notch! Their passion for what they do is so apparent in their hospitality and the attention to detail! Book here you won’t regret it!

Nous avons eu le droit à un accueil de président.  Nous avons passé 2 jours dans cette hacienda afin d'y fait un tour à cheval dans la vallée des 9 volcans.  Ce fut plus que ce que nous recherchions. Galop dans les champs et visite des alentours. Le personnel est au petit soins, les chambres sont grande et la literie confortable. Gabriel est très gentil et passionné par son travail. Un vrai bonheur d'avoir partagé ce moment avec.

Recomiendo 100% Hacienda la Alegria, un lugar tan mágico y familiar. Sus habitaciones tan confortables y cumplen con todos los protocolos.  Respiraras el aire más puro. Ehhh y que decir de la comida Tan rica y especial.  Su gente tan amable y pendiente de tus necesidades.  Sus cuatro perritos los amamos 😍😍😍 Lo recomiendo al 100%

I spent an afternoon here, watching the chagras demonstrate their horsemanship.  We saw wonderful displays of skill and then had a tour of the house.  We also met many of the animals.  It was an enjoyable afternoon.

I had the pleasure of spending 4 days riding with the Espinoza family. 3 nights at Hacienda La Alegria and 1 at Hacienda Bomboli. Great riding near the farm and a superb adventure across the mountain to a cloud forest. The horses are very fit, and if you can ride a good number of trots and long canters. The Hacienda is clean and comfortable, good home style cooking and even a jacuzzi.

this hidden gem just has it all! the horses are perfectly trained and both a fun and safe ride for different riding levels. the tack fits them perfectly and both horses and sadles are so comfortable I was 't even soar after 6 days of riding. the surroundings are just stunning and I can really recommend the cloud forest ride to bomboli...that place is just magical. I had the pleasure of meeting Gabriel and this lovely wife Paty over many delicious dinners (yes... the food is exquisit!) but it was his cousin Mauricio who guided me on the trailrides. To me Mauricio is the best guide in the world and every ride we took felt tailormade. at the Hacienda the beautiful bedrooms are very spacious and clean and the view on the mountains is exceptional. loved every second of this trip and can 't wait to go back 😊…

direccion: Interoceánica Camino a Mulauco Km 5, Pifo, Quito 170175 Ecuador
descripcion: Hacienda Las Cuevas Terra Lodge is a hotel that is located inside a cave carved in the 70s as a farm house.

comentarios.p_comentario: This place is UNBELIEVABLE.  We were blown away - with the beauty of the location, the craftsmanship of the rooms and other facilities, and the service of the staff -  and the 5-star gourmet food served in their restaurant.  The drive up and down the hills and valley’s to get to this completely private hillside resort takes you completely off the beaten path, but once you arrive you never want to leave.   This hacienda is built as large caves and tunnels all connecting with each other which was so cool.  Our 17 yr old daughter never wanted to leave as we enjoyed the large Jacuzzi, playing pool and ping pong, the Reading room, candle making, the home made cheese making, the pond and exploring the property.  So so so very cool.  If we ever travel back to Quito, we will absolutely stay here.  …

Un lugar único y mágico; fui con mi esposo por nuestro aniversario; la pasamos de maravilla. Todo estuvo espectacular; la comida ; la decoración habitación; la atención.  Hicimos maridaje de cerveza y chocolate ; y también de vino y quesos; una linda experiencia. Recomendado al 💯 por ciento

Súper recomendado! Realmente es un hermoso lugar con la mejor atención, muy cerca de Quito. Es un lugar mágico, en la cual se puede disfrutar de un vino, del mejor queso, de la mejor comida con un chef increíble, de las estrellas, y sobre todo de la compañía.

Es un lugar único, que vale la pena conocer, sus instalaciones y su historia son bastante interesantes, cuenta con todas las comodidades, un personal bastante atento y amable, y una comida de calidad.

A truly unique and amazing property.  Perched on the top of the Andes mountaintop, you will wonder if you are on the right path to get to this hidden gem of a hotel!! I strongly recommend that you use Waze!  The management was incredible, knowledgeable and really gave us personalized service.  Plan to eat at their restaurant, the chef really puts a lot of effort and thoughts into his creations and it was one of our best meals in Ecuador.  The property is quirky and whimsical, comfortable and clean.  The management has put together a great list of activities so you really do not need to leave the hotel for food or activities.  I highly recommend this lodge if you are adventurous and tired of boring hotels with no personality.  We booked it for our last night in Ecuador with a later flight the next afternoon from Quito and it was the perfect ending to our Ecuador vacation.      …

Es un lugar mágico. Las habitaciones son preciosas, muy cómodas y espaciosas, con todo lo necesario para la estadía. La comida es excelente y la atención de primera. Pudimos hacer dos caminatas, una nocturna y otra en la mañana hacía dos cascadas cercanas al lugar. Muy recomendado.

casi excelente, pero en la cena las guarniciones de los platos estaban congeladas, y el guia de la caminata si estuvo pésimo, pero pésimo, improviso todo, se reía sin sentido, super mal, aburrido la caminata, eso tienen que arreglar este tipo de personas poco preparadas.

Fue una experiencia diferente y divertida a la vez, la ubicación permite una conexión con la naturaleza, el hotel muy acogedor y limpio, la comida estuvo deliciosa, las actividades son distintas y llamativas.

Superó cualquier expectativa. Un lugar diferente con un servicio personalizado. Con actividades para todos los gustos sin comprometer la experiencia de relajación. Con el deseo de regresar pronto. Gracias Joaquín por tu conocimiento y compartirlo con tanta calidez.

El lugar es hermoso y la comida exquisita, recomiendo tomar las actividades extra como la caminata a la cascada, la cata de vino y cerveza así como la camina nocturna y terminas con una fogata viendo las estrellas. Recomendado

direccion: Mariana de Jesus E7-74 y La Pradera, Quito 170150 Ecuador
descripcion: CASA Q is an hotel that welcomes you in their 26 rooms. Located in the financial district and recreation of the capital, near by Downtown of this beautiful city cultural heritage of humanity. We offer a comfortable and warm attention, all you need to become your staying unforgettable. CASA Q HOTEL is committed to the environmental and social responsibility that shows it on his beautiful design, architecture and message on each of their cosy bedrooms. On his construction and equipment used with low impact materials respecting the environment, natural light and ventilation, water heater and kitchen with a clean, renowable energy, control water consumption and separation of waste: organic, inorganic, glass, plastic and paper. We value our traditions and the beauty of the handcraft, the osier furnitures and the carpets were elaborated by skilled ecuadorian craftsman hands; the panoramic pictures, the paintings and the ceramics mask, decorate the rooms and the whole hotel. In our little artesanal almacen we support the sell of the craft productions with fair prices and a fair trade and solidary. On frontdesk, we offer all kind of information such as city maps, things to do inside and around the city, information shows, theater and entertainment. In the cafeteria, delight yourself with an exquisite and healthy breakfast type buffet. Enjoy a salads, sandwiches, cakes, pasta and appetizer and to not forget our tipical food: humitas, tamales, quimbolitos and the very famous “Paila” ice cream. Also, during the day have a coffee or tea, courtesy of the house. The multiple use room, focused on art, culture and entertainment; We support all kind of expressions and sensitive visions of our community and people's traditions of this gentle land and diverse in the middle of the world. Also is used as a business space where workshops, presentations, seminars can be made. In the first floor living room, near by the chimney, relax, have some fun or chill out with a nice book talking about ecuadorian food, culture, heritage and biodiversity. A business center and meeting room with wifi available. A terrace surrounded with many kind of flowers and species of medicinal and aromatic plants that attracts attention and appetite of this beautiful and delicate hummingbirds. In the last living, up to the 8th floor, relax yourself on the hamacas at the solarium and at night, nearby the fireplace enjoy the scent and the flavor of the best ecuadorian cacao and coffee or with a incomparable “Canelazo”, an alcoholic drink made with a typical fruit called “naranjilla” contemplating a spectacular panoramic view of the city. The most important thing, the amability and best quality service from the hospitality students of the “Universidad Catolica del Ecuador” who develop their apprenticeships. As Casa Q, we collaborate with their training and it fills us with joy. Their cordiality and sympathy recognized by our guests, are our satisfaction and strength. CASA Q, LIVING IN HARMONY WITH THE NATURE AND THE COMMUNITY. WELCOME

comentarios.p_comentario: Very nice hotel for the price. Clean, comfortable, modern. Great staff, including the reception people who speak English (as well as Spanish, of course). Rooms are tidy and convenient. Rooftop deck offers great views (and a fun space to hang out in during a lightning storm). Staff is friendly and efficient. I would stay there again. One thing to keep in mind, it's not easy to find apparently. Our taxi driver got very lost and we had to use my cell phone to help direct him. When you reserve, if you're planning to use a taxi, you may want to message the hotel to ask them to send you an email explaining how to get there, something you can hand to the driver. Good brew pubs next door. Very quiet area considering it's a short walk to the financial district and Parque Carolina.

The room was clean and adequate with friendly staff. This hotel is in near Pradera plaza, which houses several places to eat and also a sporting area. It’s an easy walk from Carolina park, and a short taxi ride from the historic center.

Det var rigtig søde mennesker der arbejde her. De hjalp med at arrangere en tur til Cotopaxi. Morgenmaden var god, og de var gode til ag anbefale steder vi kunne gå hen. De opbevarede også vores ting da vi skulle ud i Amazon helt gratis.   Så et godt hotel

I've been traveling and needed to lodge back in the city to get to the airport for my flight. I had not heard of Casa Q Hotel, but now I know and am sharing. This hotel is like a contemporary Botique style hotel without breaking the bank.  My first impression was the architecture of the building. The rooms are nice size with space to move around. Also, customer service is excellent. Additionally, the hotel is located in a safe and nice area of town with plenty of restaurants and bars within feet from the hotel.  So far, I ve had no issues, check in was smooth, wifi is working well and the view is breathtaking.  *The Hotel offers transportation service  (fee) to the airport. *  Thanks!

Una decepción total, desde hace meses tenia planeada mis vacaciones para poder disfrutar y tener una estadia cómoda y de primera en Quito por recomendaciones de amigos y amigas, de lo maravilloso que era este hotel, pero cual fue mi asombro, el dia de ayer al llegar a la habitacion del hotel y tener este inconveniente el cual no habia tenido antes en ninguno de los hoteles que he estado,se supone que el hotel tiene una buena puntuación por ser limpio y tener las cosas bien organizadas, el día de ayer llegué, y el duvet, tenía un olor a usado, como que no habian realizado la limpieza adecuadamente, al hablar con la señorita encargada y preguntarle si alguien habia estado ya utilizando la habitacion no supo que responder, deberían tener más cuidado con la limpieza es especial con la situación actual tan critica de los casos del covid, donde deberian de brindar una atencion de calidad.…

My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Casa Q.  The hotel's layout, rooms, terrace, and decor are so thoughtfully done.  We were so comfortable there.  The location is great; near restaurants and easy taxi rides to other locales.  However, what made our stay especially great was Karol.  She was so helpful, friendly, and kind.  She felt like family before we left.  She is very gifted in her job and made our stay very memorable.  We would stay here again!

Solamente gracias se portaron excelente a pesar de todo el nerviosismo de las personas en ustedes pude encontrar apoyo y sentir seguridad fuera de casa, no me cobraron más y me dijeron que me sienta tranquilo que descanse y eso me ayudo realmente

Hotel bien ubicado cerca excelentes restaurantes, parque La Carolina. Acomodaciones agradables y desayuno rico en frutas. Lo unico que considero negativo es el espacio del baño muy reducido. De manera general considero un hotel con excelente relacción costo beneficio en Quito.

Excelente opción para viajes de trabajo, habitación cómoda, sencilla, moderna, con los justo y necesario para tener una excelente estancia, muy buena ubicación. A pocos metros existe un Food Garden que presenta muy buenas opciones de comida.

Un hotel muy bien ubicado, limpio, muy bien cuidado, personal muy atento, y el desayuno en la terraza es lo mejor, tienes una vista muy bonita mientras disfrutas de tu café.  En la tarde un momento de descanso en las amacas!!!

direccion: Cordero 444 - Avenida 12 de Octubre, Quito 170103 Ecuador
descripcion: NH Collection Quito Royal is next to the World Trade Center in the most exclusive business, financial and gastronomic areas in Quito. Located 40 minutes away from Mariscal Sucre International Airport and 15 minutes away from Historic Downtown which was declared World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Close to major attractions, shopping centers and Plaza Foch.

comentarios.p_comentario: La atención del personal es excelente, el menú del desayuno muy variado y rico. Las camas muy cómodas. Todo se encuentra muy limpio. Botellas de agua siempre en la habitación y el gimnasio. Si necesitas algo en la habitación, el servicio es inmediato. La experiencia fue muy buena.

So much to say about this hotel!! I chose to stay at NH Collection because I had stayed in several other of their hotels in different countries mainly in Europe. But this NH Collection Quito Royal exceeded any and all of my expectations!!   From the moment I arrived, the welcome I received was unmatched. After helping me settle in my suite, they took time to help me figure out what all I need to see and do. Yanira at the front desk was extremely helpful daily with any and all my many questions and requests.   I had forgotten my phone charger and Geovanny, also at the front desk offered me his personal charger for the duration of my stay. Although later on the hotel was able to provide me with one as well. Whenever I called Uber, Geovanny, Robert (Security) as well as Miguel all took time to jot down the license plate and speak with each driver briefly. If I wasn’t taking Uber, they were swift in arranging a hotel transportation for me anytime I needed one. They made me feel extremely protected and safe.   Everyday Paulina took extreme care in cleaning my Suite and replenishing anything I needed. Each day I come back it was as though the room hadn’t been used. Everything was squeaky clean!   I also met Carlos, the hotel director who introduced himself and asked me if everything was to my liking. Which of course more than that, as everything had exceeded my expectations. Carlos took great care in translating for me whenever I needed help communicating with a couple vendors over the phone. He also made excellent restaurant recommendations for me as well as taking time making reservations for me. I was so pleasantly surprised to also receive wine and cheese spread sent to my suite one of the days. And because of a late flight, I was also granted a late checkout which I truly appreciate.   This hotel is run extremely well and seamlessly. I travel all over the world (Ecuador is my 54th country), and I wish everywhere I go they would have service as amazing as the one I received at NH Collection Quito!!!!  Much thank you to everyone that made my stay amazing and most memorable. There is no where else I’ll stay when I visit Quito again in the future!!  …

My 4th time in Ecuador in business and the 4th time as guest @ NH. Good location, clean spacy rooms and excellent food. Further, if you need any assistance the kind staff will certainly help you. As result  I would not even consider another option. When home I’m always thinking back to the stunning breakfast buffe and now also on the magical Gaspacho! Hope to return soon.

El hotel tiene cuartos muy amplios y cómodos. Ideal para descansar y trabajar (buen internet y escritorio cómodo) Se recomienda pisos superiores que tienen muy buena vista.  Tal vez debería tener más personal, porque es un hotel grande.  Pero es un buen hotel recomendable

Hotel en excelente ubicación, zona muy segura y rodeada de muchos restaurantes. La habitación muy limpia y con todo los servicios. La vista desde la habitación maravillosa.  La atención del personal impecable. Podría mejorar la atención en el restaurante y la variedad de alimentos calientes.

The room is spacious with great layout. It is meticulously clean, there are handheld shower on one end and overhead shower on the other. Hot water and water flow are sufficient, beds and linens are quite comfortable. Check in is exceptionally inefficient.

Camere un po freddine nel decoro, ma complete di ogni accessorio. Colazione ricca  e di qualità, ristorante buono, forse un po' costoso.  Check-in da velocizzare, assistenza ai bagagli limitata all'ingresso.

Very nice hotel in a good and safe area, surrounded by nice restaurants and there's also a big supermarket nearby. The rooms were spacious and very clean. The personel was helpful and very nice. Breakfast was also good, with a lot of variety. I also had lunch one day at the restaurant and the food was fresh and tasty.  The hotel has a small gym with cardio machines which is very convenient if you want to keep your physical activity while abroad .   I stayed 4 nights + 3 nights after a small trip in Ecuador. The hotel kept part of my luggage until my return, so that i did not need to carry unnecessary weight.  The only inconvenient is that you will need a short taxi ride to go to city center, but there is a taxi stop in front of the hotel and the hotel also has taxi service.  Overall, a very good experience!…

Hôtel bien situé, chambre avec 2 lits double spacieuse, sdb propre, bonne literie. seul bémol pas de double vitrage donc un peu bruyant en début de nuit car karaoké, je pense, non loin de là restaurant mexicain tout proche très bon et personnel sympa aussi, à tester

Muy mala experiencia para no repetir, llegando me quice tomar una ducha el agua estaba fria, al llegar del trabajo pedi rrom service a las 8:30pm a las 10:15pm llaman a decir que se demora media hora mas; nunca llego, la habitación helada.

direccion: Calle Manuel Burbano Barrio La Palma, S/N Via a Pronaca, Puembo, Quito 170179 Ecuador
descripcion: La Palma Polo Hotel has a restaurant, swimming pools, tennis courts, polo fields, and 20 hectares (50 acres) of green areas. Our central location allows you to be at Mariscal Sucre Int'l Airport in 15 minutes, and Quito is only 30 minutes away. Easy and quick access to tourist attractions such as Cayambe, Otavalo, San Pablo Lake, etc; and the Ecuadorian Amazon region is a few hours away. Our luxury rooms include: Wifi, DirecTV, and Breakfast. Built in 2019

comentarios.p_comentario: Stayed one evening and then left early the next morning for next part of our trip. Was supposed to be a bit "fancy" according to our tour guide, but I found it "ok". Rooms have a bit of novelty looking onto a polo pitch I suppose, but otherwise wasn't exciting.   Dinner stops around 8pm, so get there early - I was glad we weren't late. We had some decent pizza and a bottle of wine that was nice enough.  My main reason for the mid-range score is this place isn't cheap, and the standard of the takeaway (we were leaving at 6am) breakfast was abysmal. Ordered one vegetarian and one normal. The veggie one had ham in.... and my non-veggie one was the cheapest white bread I've ever seen and the filling looked so cheap and nasty I threw it in the bin and bought a nice breakfast at the airport (top tip, domestic departures does a decent local style breakfast). Honestly, they should be ashamed of that food, seriously weak given they charge for the normal restaurant breakfast - which I'm sure is lovely.  Grounds are nice, plenty of interesting birdlife around if you like that kind of thing (we do!).…

We stayed twice at La Palma, once upon arriving in Quito in route to Galapagos and after in route to the Andes. It was a great decision. The hotel is beautiful. The rooms luxurious. The food delicious. And the staff were so welcoming and helpful. They helped us to arrange a car to and from the Andes. We enjoyed swimming in the pool, walking the property and seeing the variety of birds and occasional polo practices. Highly recommended!

We stayed in Room 16 in late June. Some of our travel companions were in other rooms in the new wing -- Rooms 14-17. These rooms were not ready for guest stay. In full disclosure, our travel company made a last-minute booking due to demonstrations in Quito; however, this room would be considered uninhabitable by U.S. standards.   We were told that for service, we should send a message to the front desk using WhatsApp. That was difficult because the room had spotty wifi and mobile phone coverage was somewhat weak in the area.  For dinner one night, we chose room service. We learned that the link to the restaurant menu was not valid – the menu was different that night. So I walked to the restaurant to get a menu from them and ordered via WhatsApp from the hotel lobby.  I’m sure the rooms will be suitable and lovely when live wires are capped; door handles are installed; the wood cabinets are varnished so people can’t get splinters; the leaks in the ceiling are plugged; the rear patio is finished and accessible; a means of contacting the front desk is available; bathroom installation is complete; door handles are installed; wifi reaches the new wing; shower gel is readily available; a hair dryer is included in the room; a luggage rack is made available; furniture is added; the TV is made functional; the fireplace is ready for use; the walkway to the room is given more space before a precarious 2-meter drop-off; the septic smell is flushed out; blackout curtains are installed; etc. Until then, I recommend avoiding these new, incomplete rooms.  On the positive side, the hotel manager did what he could to help us make the most of our stay, the front desk staff was exceptionally friendly, and the hotel’s continental breakfast was nicely prepared.…

My only regret about La Palma Polo Club is that we were only able to stay one night. It was our stop on our way to the Galapagos, but it's such a special and beautiful place that I could spend an entire vacation relaxing there. On top of everything, the hospitality was unbelievable.

This was an outstanding place to stay.  A group of 19 of us stayed here for a couple nights in route to the Galapagos.  It was outstanding!  We enjoyed the food, and the drinks!  They have an outstanding breakfast!  Everyone was very kind and helpful!  Cheers!  Bravo! Nicely done!

Excelente lugar , muy mágico , la comida es lo que dice la carta, buena calidad y precios,  la naturaleza su piscina. 10/10 algo importante es que aceptan mascotas , una sugerencia lleven un buen carro porque la calle es empedrada pero nada del otro 🌎

Quito Polo Club is a beautiful oasis on the outskirts of Quito.  It’s not only a beautiful hotel on real polo grounds with polo matches on the weekends, but offers its guests a top notch restaurant, an array of activities ranging from horseback riding to tennis to dirt biking. On top of the amenities, the service is completely unbeatable.  We had a prolonged trip to Ecuador spanning the Amazon to the Galápagos Islands and stayed at the hotel 3 separate times over the course of 18 days.  To say they were accommodating is an understatement! They held various pieces of luggage ie snorkel gear until our return, arranged washing of our clothes, meal accommodations, making us popcorn at the end of a day, to name a few.  On our last day, when we had planned on dirt biking for our 8 year old son, there was some last minute mishap, and to not disappoint- Franklin - the manager there- quickly called an owner who in 30 minutes brought over his 4X4 and he got to drive that around the polo fields instead!! Lets just say he still talks about that as one of his favorite experiences of the trip.  Franklin is just an amazing asset, an incredibly kind genuine person and we would most definitely stay there again!!…

I visited this place with my family for a shot trip away from Quito. Rooms are perfectly neat and all the common areas are great as well. You might find limited alternatives to eat and drink but Hotel's Staff will do anything in their hand to assist you.  The pool is relatively small. Not great to swim but perfect to relax and enjoy.  Will I recommend this place to my family and friends? Absolutely.

Really enjoyed our short stay- having spent a week in the Galapagos, the Polo Club was the perfect place to chill and relax. Lovely room, peaceful and relaxing atmosphere. We had a delicious dinner- very attentive service from friendly and welcoming staff. Ideal last stop before heading to the airport and home. Highly recommended.

The most wonderful place I have every stayed! The property, the rooms and the service is exceptional. The manager, Franklin, is so kind, and helpful and committed to his guests. A small, green, intimate resort where you could easily spend a week of affordable luxury or, if you have a layover, lucky you to be able to stay in a place like this, close to the airport. Thank you for everything - we will be back.

direccion: Manuel Burbano S7-150 y San Fernando, Puembo, Quito 170179 Ecuador
descripcion: Don't stop your trip at an Airport Hotel!!!, let the destination reach you at San Jose de Puembo, Quito Airport, Ascend Hotel by Choice Hotels. SAN JOSE DE PUEMBO ASCEND HOTEL, (free airport shuttle and buffet breakfast ) an Ascend Hotel Collection by Choice Hotels. Only at 15 minutes from Quito's International Airport and 30 minutes from Quito's colonial center. Our pet-friendly Quito hotel is located Ecuadorean Andes in the heart of the Puembo in a restored colonial building, the Hacienda San Jose, which dates back to the 18th Century. Our 78 luxury rooms hotel has 9 meeting rooms, which can accommodate up to 400 people for banquets and conferences, 2 heated pools Indoor and outdoor, whirlpools, fitness center and SPA. You can also enjoy traditional Ecuadorean and international cuisine at our Le Gourmet or Patio de la Cruz restaurants, walk in our magnificent 40.000m2 garden with centennial trees and more than 30 species of birds or enjoy a horseback ridding along the Hacienda San José.

comentarios.p_comentario: We stayed here twice for a total of three nights. We'd definitely stay here again.  We stayed in the newer 800-series rooms, which were spacious and well-appointed. The grounds are gorgeous and have decent birding. The grazing llamas are a definite plus. Access to the airport is good and the hotel provides a free shuttle. The staff is attentive. The included breakfast buffet is excellent. You can enjoy a well-priced massage at the spa.  Jets landing at the airport fly over the hotel. The noise is notable but not bothersome. The bathroom in our second stay leaked and the window curtain overlooking the gardens collapsed as we were leaving the hotel. Otherwise, we had no hitches.

What a beautiful place. Nestled amongst some of the best kept garden grounds we have seen. The food and service crews are great and friendly, however we always come back for the SPA services. Adrianita the Spa masseuse is a hidden gem and her outstanding massage techniques will leave you feeling renewed and ready for the day. Great place, food, and Spa services what else can you ask for! Paul from Chicago USA

Hicimos una reunión familiar, disfrutamos muchísimo del lugar, las habitaciones limpias, la piscina temperada perfecta, la comida deliciosa. El desayuno fue buffet, los niños adoraron la experiencia. Tiene unos jardines enormes con fuentes de agua muy lindas con hortensias, también  hacen paseos a caballo para los niños, lindo lugar para tomarse fotos.

My husband and I stayed one night at the hotel unexpectedly. We were planning on staying in old town Quito as part of a tour, but the tour and original hotel reservation were cancelled due to street demonstrations by indigenous people in the highlands. San Jose de Puembo was lovely, with beautiful gardens and extremely clean. The room was spacious with a great view of the gardens and the mountains and city in the distance. Restaurant food was delicious and the staff were extremely nice and accommodating. There is a free shuttle to the airport which we reserved in order to get to the airport for out midnight flight.  Our first attempt to get to the airport was unsuccessful because all routes were blocked due to burning tires. Our shuttle driver tried multiple routes but we had to return to the hotel. The experience was beyond frightening to say the least.  Soon after, the driver informed us that another driver would try to get us to the airport by using a different backroads route. This time we were also accompanied by by a hotel restaurant waitress. Again, the driver tried multiple ways to get around roads blocked with burning tires. We finally got close to the airport and the driver went right up to a road block. The amazing waitress (who puts writing pens in her hair bun) got out of the van and negotiated with a group of protesters.  Then she and the driver shoved a roadwork plastic barrier enough to move burning tires out of the way for the van to pass. We got to the airport with 10 minutes to spare and made our flight. The driver and waitress were absolutely fantastic and courageous.  Upon exiting the shuttle bus at the airport the driver commented that we were likely never to return to Quito. I disagree. After the protests end around Quito I will most certainly return and stay at San Jose de Puembo to visit the city and surrounding areas. The hotel staff brought customer service to whole new level for me.…

The shuttle to and from the airport is free and we were met by a guy with a sign with our name on it in arrivals which made the 10/15 minute  transfer quick and easy. The grounds are beautiful, complete with a mum and baby llama wandering around and lots of birds. Its a great place for a long stopover. The new rooms and bathrooms are spacious and well appointed. We didnt try the pool as it was wet and chilly. We ate 3 meals in the restaurant and food was vey good. They do have a wood burning stove  in the centre of the restaurant which was welcome in an evening and large centrepieces of beautiful roses on each table. Make sure you find the billiard table if you play pool

I would give them a 5 for the charm, grounds, llamas, and the amazing staff. Also large rooms. However there were insects in the room. I got about 80 bites in two nights, all while inside the hotel. Mostly on my feet, including the bottom of my feet. My two friends, in 2 other rooms, also were bitten in areas indicating we were bit while sleeping. Manager Fernando was very kind about it. I appreciated that, but my feet looked like they were covered with welts. It really ruined the next 3 days of my trip in other locations. Hotels should either give you a room without biting insects, or provide a mosquito net. It they want to air out the room by opening the window, put screens on. I was sad to have a bad experience here because it is really a charming place.

I stayed three separate times for a birding trip. We birded the lovely grounds and saw several colorful species. The ecuadorian food was good; the buffet breakfast was a nice spread & dinners were tasty. There were fresh roses on all the tables. Drinking water is provided. Staff was professional. The small rooms near the dining area were musty-smelling though.

A lovely hotel.  My room was beautiful looking out over the grounds and could see great birds from my room.   The room had everything, wifi,  and for the first time on this trip the ability to make coffee in the room.  The bathroom was spectacular with an overhead shower.   all lovely.  The restaurant was attractive and the food was great. They have a shuttle to the airport which was only a 20 minute drive and do not have to go to downtown Quito, a real bonus

less than 15 minutes away from the airport, the Hosteria is a great place with vast green areas with gigantic trees, very quiet and peaceful with lamas grazing the green lawns. Nice rooms with comfortable beds and pillows and windows to the central garden. The staff is very nice and helpful but you'll need to brush up your spanish to converse with them. I came here several times already and was very pleased at each time. Recommended for business ( they also have conference rooms...), for families and couples.

Lush gardens, colorful flowers, charming walkways all contribute to a sense of calm and relaxation at San Jose de Puembo. We stayed there twice, once on arrival in Quito ahead of our trip to the Galapagos and again before our return flight home to the US. Both times, we enjoyed the charming hacienda, the gardens, the spa, and the restaurant. It’s a quick 20 minutes via the complimentary transfer from the airport to the hotel. We had a minor hitch the first time, and had to call to get a pickup (advice: call or email ahead of time and get a confirmation that the hotel will meet your flight). The hotel quickly managed to arrange a taxi. For the second stay, a car awaited us.  The spa (Joyas de Ecuador) at San Jose de Puembo offers massages and facials. It’s won awards for being eco-friendly, it's very reasonable … and it’s also just plain friendly. What a lovely way to start and end our Ecuador vacation.  The restaurant was excellent and moderately priced. The breakfast buffet was included with the room rate and offered plenty of options. Dinner wasn't fancy but fresh and delicious (especially liked the shrimp in coconut sauce). The wine list was limited. A tip: the chocolate bars sold in the lobby are high quality and cheaper than what we saw elsewhere.…

direccion: Av. Amazonas N24-29 y Joaquin Pinto, Quito 170517 Ecuador
descripcion: The Hotel is located in the Northern Center of the city, in the main tourist and economic area of the capital, surrounded by the best shopping streets and establishments of large social and cultural activity. Hotel Bonaventure offers carpeted rooms with spacious beds in simple accommodations, double and triple rooms, fully equipped with excellent service and comfort for your stay whether for work or pleasure.

comentarios.p_comentario: Visit to Hotel Bonaventure was short, as the did not keep any of their promises and agreements which we had madw beforehand, like transport from airport, no one was there respond, like room price as price was agreed in Ebookers reservation, but hotel has not made reservation and they offered lousu room for higher price, so I left hote and went another. Ebookers/Expedia did not even tried to help me to get back my payment from hotel as they tried to delegate response to other even Ebookers was arranged travel and was in response of failures.

Ik heb veel backpackervaring, maar ik heb op weinig plaatsen geslapen waar het zo verschrikkelijk was.  Het 2 persoonsbed was zo klein dat je strak tegen elkaar aan ligt.   De kamer is zo ontzettend slecht geïsoleerd dat  je elk geluid van het hele hotel kan horen. We lagen op de bovenste verdieping, en als iemand bij de binnenkomst bij de receptie iets zegt, lijkt het alsof degene langs je bed staat.  Er was veel kapot in de kamer, de spiegel en de lamp die de hele nacht bleef knipperen.  De gordijnen laten licht door.  De douche is ijs en ijskoud.  Het ontbijt is zeer matig.

A equipe do hotel transmitiu confiança e seriedade na prestação do serviço. Destaco a honestidade e a o tratamento personalizado que recebi. Tudo o que foi combinado durante a reserva foi observado. O café da manhã é servido sem a opção "buffet livre", contudo como "prato feito" é profundamente saboroso. Solicitei o translado ("transfer") na ida e na volta ao hotel. O serviço foi executado pelo Sr. Alfredo (um taxista) que serve ao hotel. O hotel cobra 28 dólares (valor em julho de 2019) para cada trecho (ida ou volta) de transfer. Dica aos viajantes: a tomada no quarto segue o modelo dos Estados Unidos. Não há elevador, logo os hóspedes precisam subir com as malas nas mãos. Isso também pode ser um empecilho para quem tem problemas de mobilidade. Na chegada, o banheiro não estava limpo, contudo nos outros dias tal problema foi corrigido e todo o quarto estava impecável. A ausência de um frigobar no quarto também é algo que o hotel precisa melhorar.  Não há almoço ou janta para ofertar no estabelecimento.…

For the price we paid for the room I am extremely disappointed. We arrived late at night in the rain so we got straight into the hotel to pay and get our room. The 1st room they gave us was not what we had booked nor was the second but at 2.30am we had no choice. After we got into our room I had to leave the hotel to get something and the receptionist wouldn't let me leave??? I have never had this is any other hotel in my life. The sheets were stained, we had no toilet paper on arrival and I cant see any room with a terrace (like we booked). The amenities on booking.com do not match the amenities in the hotel as far as I can see.  Would not recommend this hotel.

El hotel hoy en día se presta para funcionar como motel por ratos ,las habitaciones descuidadas con humedad en las paredes y hongos en las duchas ,los muebles viejos y en mal estado ,la pintura deteriorada lo cual refleja el poco mantenimiento que le realizan ,la verdad una lástima pues la ubicación del hotel es buena . Cuando llegamos nos mostraron una habitación y nos dieron otras muy malas por lo cual solicitamos el cambio y aunque las cambiaron también nos cobraron un sobreprecio. No lo recomiendo y además menos para una familia

Hotel bueno atención súper. Mucho frio en la ciudad. Desayuno rico.  Fue buena opción es Quitó. Fue fácil llegar en transporte público. Accesible. Muy amables. Dispuestos a solucionar todo. Tal vez agua tibia.  A veces no salía caliente.

Was looking for a cheap place to stay close to the Parque el Ejido - a 10-min walk. Front desk person was kind. I had an inner room with a glass window that faced the interior of the hotel. There were two girls or young women who talked at laughed until 4:30 am. It was like they were standing at the foot of my bed. I had lukewarm water at best for a shower. Bathroom could have been cleaner, and for goodness' sake, vacuum the stupid carpets and clean the floors!

La atención del personal del hotel es muy buena, son muy amables y serviciales. El desayuno es bastante bueno. El único defecto es el agua caliente pues tarda mucho en salir. La zona donde el hotel está ubicado no es tan segura.

Al llegar a Quito nos recomendaron el Hotel Bonaventure, llegar desde el Terminal de Transporte fue sencillo, a unos 20 minutos aproximadamente. Queda muy cerca de la Plaza Foch y es realmente cómodo. La atención fue muy buena, camas supremamente cómodas y agua caliente a un precio muy accesible y ajustado a nuestro presupuesto. Incluía desayuno con fruta, chocolate y huevos, realmente delicioso, lo mejor fue la atención de quienes trabajan allí. Totalmente recomendado

This was my last weekend in Quito and I wanted lodgings close enough to Plaza Foch so as to be able to enjoy a party weekend.  It turns out that Hotel Bonaventure's location is both a blessing and a curse. It was close enough to the Plaza to be able to get to all the nightspots and drinking establishments that I was looking to frequent.  But it was also directly above (well, beside) a bottle-o, over the road from a popular corner for working ladies, and on a reasonably busy street.  Add to this, the windows being porous because of their design, and well, not much sleep was possible on Saturday night.  The solution was to go out all night, and I have to say that Sunday night was much calmer.  The good: the people who worked there were friendly. The bad:  my room was not cleaned prior to my arrival.  This was rectified the next day, but I have no stock with properties that don't clean rooms before admitting guests.  I had booked in advance, and arrived in the evening, so there was no excuse for the disgusting state of the floor of both my bedroom and bathroom.  …

direccion: García Moreno N 6-52 Between Olmedo and Mejía, Quito 170401 Ecuador
descripcion: Style, Comfort and nice Atmosphere in the center of the Colonial Quito Hotel Patio Andaluz Quito, elegant Boutique hotel located to only 150 meters (490 ft.) of the Main Square also known as the Independence Plaza, Located in a colonial style house of the end of the XVI Century, this hotel that displays great arcs and inner Patios lies at only 7 minutes walk of the recognized Church and Square of San Francisco; at 5 minutes walk of the famous “La Compañia;” at 6 minutes walk to the “Sucre Theater”, stage of important events; among other places of great interest within the Colonial Quito such as museums, churches and historical sites. Rainforest Alliance Certified Hotel, spacious restaurant “El Rincón de Cantuña”, inside its main Patio offers excellent options of Ecuadorian and International flavors.

comentarios.p_comentario: The entire staff were amazing, they were so hospitable and friendly. The room was large and had two levels: bedroom downstairs and bathroom and living room upstairs. Keep in mind that the building is old so the walls are thin. The bed was as firm as they come and unfortunately there was hair on one of the pillows. The room includes a hair dryer, toiletries, and A/C, and there is a grocery and a bank next door. The free wifi is great in the onsite restaurant but is weak in the rooms. They provide a small pitcher of water and a glass in your room and there are several water refill areas around the hotel. The free breakfast is adequate and if you have an early departure before breakfast starts they'll pack a meal for you.   They provide airport transfer (for a fee) and personally I recommend Alex if you choose to request the transfer; he provides excellent service. They can also assist with requesting a taxi if you're traveling around town at night when safety is a heightened issue.   Concerning ADA, there is a flight of stairs to get to the first level of guest rooms so unfortunately it isn't accessible. Overall this is a great hotel and I would stay there again in the future. …

Absolutely loved our stay at the hotel!   The room was so very comfortable & well appointed !  The hotel staff were amazing, so very gracious & great service ! The dinner & breakfast we had was so very yummy!   Can’t say enough about this beautiful hotel & the staff. Just wish our stay was longer.

Très bel hôtel en plein centre historique, doté de deux magnifiques patios dont l'une abrite le restaurant. La rénovation est superbe et l'endroit très accueillant et agréable à l’image du personnel toujours prompt à rendre service  Les chambres sont bien, petite salle de bains, problème d'évacuation qu'il conviendrait de régler, le petit déjeuner est juste bien sans fioriture. On gardera un bon souvenir de notre venue.

Due to the proximity of Quito demonstrations and related police activity and access restrictions we couldn't stay at the hotel in late June.  But I wanted to write about how the hotel kept us informed about the dynamic situation and eventually cancelled our reservation when police restricted access to old Town on the day of our arrival.  Using whatsapp Roger at the hotel provided us status reports and subsequently worked with us to cancel the reservation when it became apparent that we could not reach the hotel.  Thank you Roger for you proactive communications and great customer service.  While we could not enjoy and experience the hotel on this trip, perhaps another time in the future.

I stayed here only for 1 night, but this place is in my opinion magical. It is such a beautiful building - very colonial and majestic - with beautiful interior and nice and cosy rooms.  Situated in the old part of Quito close to the old square and several churches, shops, restaurants and museums. Staff is very serviceminded as well!

I just loved this hotel. Great location in the old town. A short walk to restaurants, the main park, many churches. The hotel had a lot of charm and character. The staff were very kind. I enjoyed my meals at the restaurant.

Very comfortable historic hotel right in the centre of Quito's old town that is a very well protected World Heritage site.   One of the world's great breakfast experiences in a 17th century glazed courtyard, where top quality food enhances what is visually an excellent experience. We stayed here to get a private tour of Quito and then visit the Cotopaxi volcano on our last day before flying on the US.   Our flight from Galapagos went wrong the previous day and had we not allowed the day for Quito then we would have missed our connection. We were sad to literally have only bed and breakfast at this superbly run wonderful hotel but equally relieved to have a very full last day in Ecuador.  Would highly recommend staying here, particularly if doing a city tour or even better combining a city tour, Cotopaxi tour and an airport transfer in one.…

Quite a perfect place. Centrally located, great ambiance and decor, and very friendly staff that really wants you to have a comfortable stay. In some rooms there is no heat and Quito can get quite chilly at night, but they did have a space heater that worked just fine to make the room comfortable. I’d very much endorse this hotel to anyone looking for a stay in Quito.

Hotel Patio Andaluz is not only an incredibly inviting and charming Quito hotel ideally located in easy walking distance to many sites in the historic district, it offers unparalleled customer service. Our long-awaited trip to Quito (and then onto the Amazon) was @2 1/2 years in the planning due to Covid because of an abrupt halt to our trip in 2020. I could not be more grateful to all the amazing staff at Hotel Patio Andaluz who worked with me over the years - yes years! - with faith and diligence that we would ultimately get to Quito safely with our group of 26. No matter who I corresponded with regularly on email, chatted or spoke with, everyone was always friendly and helpful, and eager to assist with requests that went above and beyond - especially with very unique and challenging requests due to navigating travel during the Covid pandemic. The rooms at Hotel Patio Andaluz are neat and clean, and retain a unique charm unlike a big hotel chain. I stayed there 5 nights on the inbound, and then 2 days before traveling back to the US. The atrium is a beautiful, inviting dining area where we enjoyed many meals and lively group gatherings with good air circulation and spacing. In all my years of travel, I've never encountered more helpful, hard-working hotel staff who helped with a variety of needs including local recommendations on dining and transportation (which were excellent and a tremendous help for me in the early trip planning stages), sorting our Covid testing, luggage assistance at all hours, expedited and smooth check-ins...really the definition of consistent excellence in customer service in the hospitality industry. I cannot imagine a more perfect welcome upon arrival in Ecuador for anyone than a stay at Hotel Patio Andaluz! I am so grateful to have found it since it was an integral part of our successful trip.…

Great location in the historic district within walking distance to all the cultural sites we wanted to see.  The room was clean & comfortable, and overall the hotel was very quiet (always a plus).  The property is in a historic building, but is well maintained and the staff keeps it very clean.  Alejandra at the front desk was OUTSTANDING.  She helped us with everything, from getting a car to take us all around Quito one day, to arranging our COVID tests for follow-on travel, to arranging transportation back to the airport.  She is a very knowledgeable young lady ... smart, polite, and friendly (we chatted with her just about every time we came or went during our stay).

nombre_id: Hotel Rincon De Puembo, BW Signature Collection
direccion: Manuel Burbano N6-66 y Francisco Ruiz, Puembo, Quito 170179 Ecuador
descripcion: Hosteria Rincon de Puembo, the perfect place for your next stay in Quito. The hotel is located conveniently near the Quito airport in the beautiful village of Puembo. Upon arriving to this charming place rest, relax, and taste the most exquisite local and international food with the company of your family and friends. Regardless of what brings you to Quito, rest assured that your stay will be successful. Enjoy the excellence of service and the friendly treatment that Rincon de Puembo is known for. Hotel Facilities - Las Cupulas Restaurant - El Grill Bar and Restaurant - Large gardens - Heated pool - Sauna - Jacuzzi - Gym - Business Center - Soccer, basketball, and volleyball courts - Children's area and inflatable castle - Parlor games: Billiards, table football - Karaoke room - TV and reading room - Room service - International phone - Laundry service - Business center. Guest Accommodation: Guests of the hotel will find comfortable accommodation in the eighteen rooms, comprised of a variety of options.
