Standard and double rooms with two or three beds, rooms to suit handicapped travelers, suites and two-level townhouse family suites are available to ensure that every guest has a pleasant stay. All rooms include cable television, 24-hour Wi-Fi access, Spa & Leisure bath amenities, hairdryer and iron, as well as premium linens and bedding. An American breakfast is also included or a breakfast corner for early departures, the perfect way to stay your day in this colonial city. Hotel Dining Options: Las Cupulas Restaurant : With a distinguished atmosphere, the restaurant is decorated with beautiful domes, capturing the surrealist style of the well known Endara Crow. It is a place that invites you to taste a distinguished menu from the finest national and international cooking, worthy of the company of the best wines. El Grill Bar Restaurant : El Grill offers countryside ambiance and an informal atmosphere. Located next to the pool, it is surrounded by gardens and water fountains. This is the ideal place to enjoy the sun, snacks, or a good charcoal grilled meal prepared in front of you. It is also the ideal place to enjoy a nice cold beer or delicious tropical cocktails.

comentarios.nombreh_id: Hotel Rincon De Puembo, BW Signature Collection
comentarios.p_comentario: Excellent hotel! Very cute and small. Staff is very accommodating and helpful. There is a huge attention to detail. This isn’t like one of the huge chain hotels in the US. This one is quite pretty and has an outdoorsy energy. The restaurants on site make amazing food as well.

comentarios.nombreh_id: Hotel Rincon De Puembo, BW Signature Collection
comentarios.p_comentario: It’s somewhat a secluded hotel about 20 min from Quito airport. It’s in the village of Puembo, local eateries are within walking distances.  It has a resort feel, complete with pool, bars and restaurant.  The bedroom was spacious, very clean with comfortable bed. WiFi was very reliable.  Breakfast included, boxed for those with early morning flights. Shuttle from/to UIO included. The staff are very very friendly. Very reasonably priced.

comentarios.nombreh_id: Hotel Rincon De Puembo, BW Signature Collection
comentarios.p_comentario: I was quarantined here due to covid. The staff were very  kind, accommodating, some of the meals were just amazing,  Made testing arrangements for me. Best food in eight days in Ecuador,  there was a wedding for a few hours while I was there, didn’t bother me, but when people want to have their reception there…. Didn’t stay there by choice, but I’m very glad I did. It’s exactly what you want, quiet, charming, safe….

comentarios.nombreh_id: Hotel Rincon De Puembo, BW Signature Collection
comentarios.p_comentario: Hicimos una reserva para el día 17/06/22. Pero mo sabíamos que habría manifestaciones en el País. Ayer pedimos el cancelamiento de la reserva por razón de fuerza maior e, increiblemente, nos dijo que nada podía hacer. Una terrible insensible.  El peor servicio que he visto en toda mi vida. Péssimo gusto. Que no reservan este hotel se no quieren passar por péssimos momentos!!!  Repito: la jefa del Front Desk es increiblemente estúpida, me trató como un imbécile completo!

comentarios.nombreh_id: Hotel Rincon De Puembo, BW Signature Collection
comentarios.p_comentario: The rooms were spacious and bedding comfortable.  Missing a face washcloth.  Noisy on weekends but quiet by 10ish,  Food was good, recommend the fajitas.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Did not have laundry info in room but called and got laundry done

comentarios.nombreh_id: Hotel Rincon De Puembo, BW Signature Collection
comentarios.p_comentario: My husband and I stayed here two days prior to our Galapagos cruise, and loved it! Jose and Natalia are wonderful hosts, as well as their whole staff...we were very well taken care of! The Hotel is close to the airport, very convenient after a long day of travel! The grounds are beautiful, the food and drinks were delicious...and a very clean property!

comentarios.nombreh_id: Hotel Rincon De Puembo, BW Signature Collection
comentarios.p_comentario: The hotel is a handsome hacienda-style compound about a 20-minute cab ride from the airport.  The hotel is laid out in a series of lovely courtyards with beautiful tiled floors, ceiling murals and an inviting pool and bar area.  Our kids loved playing foosball and pool in the games area, and there's a big yard adjacent to the swimming pool for kids to run around in.  In comparison to the highly decorated public areas, the rooms are minimalist, but comfortable and clean.  The service was great; these were very friendly people who treated a tired traveling family very well.  The price was quite reasonable.

comentarios.nombreh_id: Hotel Rincon De Puembo, BW Signature Collection
comentarios.p_comentario: Following a memorable trip to Ecuador and Galapagos, my wife had the misfortune of being quarantined in Ecuador for 10 days, in Quito. Luckily, she also had the good fortune to be quarantined at the Hosteria Rincon de Puembo during that time.  Let me begin by thanking  General Manage Jose Louis Granga and his staff at Hosteria Rincon de Puembo in Quito, Ecuador for their amazing efforts to assist her at a time when she was confined for more than a week in their hotel with Covid. Their gracious hospitality, combined with their vigilance in order to protect both her and the other guests in the hotel was amazing. This, in spite of the challenges of having a quarantined guest.  Not only did they care for her, they also took care to protect their other guests as well.  Hosteria Rincon de Puembo is a lovely oasis, with peaceful gardens and a lovely swimming pool (which sadly she couldn't take advantage of) combined with great food, that made a difficult time with a Covid quarantine much more pleasant. And Jose Louis epitomizes the best of a  Hosteria Director.  She was quarantined for 10 days this past January and Jose was her lifeline, both in providing the room and meal service, which was superb, as well as helping to arrange and provide medical service and travel assistance.  He and his staff did everything to make a bad situation better for her.  Jose arranged for a doctor, helped fill prescriptions and kept in contact on a daily basis either in person or by text.  He advised her when to make flight arrangements and organized transportation to the airport, always with kindness and a smile.  His staff and chef prepared great meals and excellent service, brought right to her room.  If I can recommend a vacation hotel while visiting Quito, Ecuador, it would be  Hosteria Rincon de Puembo.  My family and I hope to return to Quito in the future and stay again at  Hosteria Rincon de Puembo.  Many Thanks Jose and staff.…

comentarios.nombreh_id: Hotel Rincon De Puembo, BW Signature Collection
comentarios.p_comentario: We stayed on our first and last nights in Ecuador, as this had an easy shuttle to the airport. The staff was focused on meeting our needs, and they were friendly to chat with. The property has beautiful gardens with comfortable outdoor lounging areas. There are foosball and pool tables. We didn’t use the pool due to timing, but it was quite inviting. The rooms were spacious and clean. We had a charming view of the surrounding area. The restaurant has beautiful hand-painted murals on the ceiling. The food was delicious, and they accommodated for my vegetarian diet. My son and I went for an evening stroll around the nearby town square, and it just added to the charm of this place. We loved it!

comentarios.nombreh_id: Hotel Rincon De Puembo, BW Signature Collection
comentarios.p_comentario: This hotel was chosen for us as part of a Birding Tour Package for the last night of our tour probably because of the proximity to the airport but also because it was exquisite.  It was so outrageously beautiful we stayed for two extra nights on our own. The staff was professional and gracious to the max.  When I told them it was my birthday, they went over the top and when we arrived in the dining room, it was decorated with balloons, flowers and strings of HAPPY BIRTHDAY messages.  They made a special birthday cake too.  Our room was amazing. It felt like a townhouse and was super clean. Because of COVID, we had the hot tub/jacuzzi to ourselves.  The gardens were well cared for and the birds loved them, too.  I had a fabulous massage in my room that the front desk arranged for me. A+++…

direccion: Av. Amazonas N-23-44 y Veintimilla, Quito 170150 Ecuador
descripcion: This chic hotel with spa and gym facilities is in the heart of the lively Mariscal district. All rooms have city views and free Wi-Fi. Massage sessions can be booked. At Hotel Reina Isabel guests can relax in the sauna room or visit El Ejido Park, 6 blocks away. Quito's historic center is 4.8 km away. Air-conditioned rooms at Reina Isabel are elegantly styled with parquet floors, upholstered chairs and an earth-toned palette. The suites have iPod docking stations and some of them have hot tubs. A american breakfast with regional jams, bread and coffee can be enjoyed daily. Lumo Restaurant offers international cuisine and room service, and after-dinner drinks. Shuttle service to Mariscal Sucre Airport, can be arranged.

comentarios.p_comentario: Room old-fashioned, dark and worn-out. It was difficult to adjust the temperature of the shower (1 mm too the left = cold / 1mm to the right = burning hot). You can listen the street and the elevator during the night. Breakfast and staff ok. Hotel located in a dangerous zone of Quito, you should avoid walking around in the neighborhood, especially after 6pm.

Llegue ya entrada la noche, sali a comer a restaurantes cerca del lugar y volvi sin mayor comlicación salvo el frio. Todo impecable y muy recomendable. Resulta que al bajar a desayunar olvide mi llaves dentro de la habitación, y me dieron otra muy rápido y con mucha amabilidad.

Picked an hotel because there was a deal on it and it turned out to be perfect choice. Somewhere in the middle between old town (15m walk to Cathedral) and Carolina park (15m as well) and like 2m walk to area with many restaurants. Big room, nice view, necessary ammenities, good breakfast. Wonderful staff, had no issues with late checkout as my flight was late im the afternoon. Good value for money.

Wonderful hotel. Suites are spacious and clean! Very friendly and helpful staff. They care for your safety.  Location is great!  Breakfast is good but basic. If you want to experience traditional breakfast food. You won’t find it here.  Towels could be newer and better.

This hotel was great value.  Modern, all the amenities, comfortable bed, very good shower, and very fast internet.  Great location in the Marisal area.  Can walk to restaurants, shops, Ejido Park, Artesanal market, nightlife.  The staff was friendly and accommodating.  The included breakfast feasured eggs, fresh fruit, croissants and other similar breakfast breads, ham and cheese, fresh squeezed orange juice, good coffee.

HRI is a lovely boutique hotel in the Mariscal area of Quito. My stay was broken up into 2 portions, with a trip to the rainforest in between, during which, at no extra charge, they kept my extra belongings safe. The first portion of my trip was really great. After a very difficult flight (flight was late, missed my driver, and airline lost my luggage), they upgraded me to a suite with their compliments, and what a great room it was! It had a fridge, coffee bar, bidet, and a spa tub the size of a swimming pool! Upon my return after the jungle trip, I stayed in a standard room, which was also very comfortable. The staff at the front desk are great, standouts are Alex, Jorman, and a girl whose name I can't remember (sorry). :/ Adriana, housekeeper, was so very kind and ready to help make me feel at home in my room however she could. I highly recommend this hotel! I would come back again and again.…

This was our second stay at this hotel. Both times the rooms were lovely. Staff is wonderful and it's a beautiful hotel in a great location. Our only complaint this time is that the room we were given was on the 2nd floor with windows directly over the main street (Avenida de Los Amazones). We hardly got any sleep with all the street noise. Motorcycles all night, cars stopping at the light then gunning it, drunks yelling and on weekends, open-air party buses blaring music. We recommend the hotel but suggest requesting a room away from the street!!

I have stayed at this hotel the last two times I have gone to Quito and I really like it.  It is modern, rooms are very comfortable and the location is prefect.  Is located in the Mariscal area and walking distance to Plaza Foch which is where you can find nightlife in Quito.  The included breakfast was also good.  Pretty basic, eggs, breads, coffee, natural juices cold cuts.  Service was pretty good.  The staff is always willing to give you suggestions or answer to any of your questions.  The area is pretty safe, although it is not recommended to wonder at night.  It is best to get a taxi or car service to come back to the hotel from Plaza Foch.  Taxi drive is $2 which is the minimum.  You can find a variety of restaurants and cafes around the hotel as well.  You can also walk to the Mercado Artesanal which is where you can get all your souvenirs.  Overall, great hotel and will definitely recommend it.…

Quiero resaltar el servicio de Fernanda de recepción ya que a pesar de no ser huésped me ayudó brindándome información, es muy atenta y se preocupa realmente por dar una buena impresión. Felicito en gran manera su trabajo

This is a stunning hotel spotlessly clean dedicated staff a warm welcome awaits from the front desk team to your whole stay, There is no Doubt that this Hotel is the Jewel in the Bull Hotels Portfolio, just returned from the most relaxing week ever. your treated as family and feels like your Home, would recommend this hotel to anybody and having worked in the hospitality industry, this hotel decor  is second to none, well done for all the staff for their attention to detail  MRS & Mr C Binley

direccion: Juan José Flores N3-49 Between Sucre & Junín, Quito 170150 Ecuador
descripcion: Rincón Familiar Hostel Boutique is located at Quito's Old Town, in the most beautiful part of the city, which is awarded by UNESCO as Heritage Cultural of Humanity. We are truly well located at Quito's Old Town, just a few steps of squares, museums, churches and touristic places with plenty of art & coulture. For example: just two corners from our hotel, we find the President Palace and La Ronda, and in just 3 blocks we find the most iconic churches of Latin America, Iglesia de la Compania de Jesus and La Basilica del Voto Nacional. Regarding transportation, we are very near of main bus stations, that's why our guest have a great facility to catch public transportation. Delicious breakfast is included. We also have different kinds of accommodation: Single Confort, Double Economy, Double Confort, Triple Confort & Family Rooms and Loft Deluxe. We have Private backyards full of beautiful gardening, Private bathrooms with hot water. TV LED with Netflix and Youtube (Chrome-cast). WiFi in all the place and computers for free, luggage room, safety boxes, reading room and a fantastic terrace with Panecillo`s view. We also provide with tourism information, Laundry (not included), Airport Transfer (not included) Our hotel has been fully refurbished just few years ago, that's why our place is very new & comfortable. This is truly your home in Quito, this is Rincón Familiar Hotel Boutique.

comentarios.p_comentario: El hospedaje estuvo muy bueno, la atención brindada por el personal muy buena, es un hostal en el centro histórico de Quito muy bien ubicada a pesar que para que lleguen los taxis por llamada se me complicó.

La estancia en el Rincón Familiar Hostel Boutique fue fantástica, muy agradable. El personal súper amable y atento a mis preguntas y necesidades, la limpieza muy bien, los desayunos ricos y en general la estancia todo bien

Muy buena ubicación para visitarnel centro histórico, cerca de la parada del bus turístico. Habitaciones limpias, buen servicio, buena atención y el desayuno es acorde al precio pagado. Recomendado.  :)

My wife and I stayed at Rincón Familiar for three nights whilst visiting Quito. We had a lovely room, great shower, wifi and breakfast. Our room was very clean and a big shout out to Raulito who was always on hand to help out if we needed anything. Would definitely stay here again when visiting Quito.

Lovely little hotel walking distance to all the main part of the city. Clean and comfortable room. Great outside spaces. Very good breakfast.  The only thing that may be a problem for some would be the steep ( ish) stairs to get to the rooms. The staff were all very helpfully. I stayed for a week and was very comfortable there as a solo women traveller.  I would stay there again.

Für 1-3 Nächte ist es perfekt um die Altstadt zu erkunden . Gutes Prei/Leistungsverhältnis. Das  Frühstück könnte vielfältiger sein. Der Flughafentranfer hat super gekappt. Nettes und hilfsbereites Personal/Besitzer . Allerdings ziemlich enge, steile Treppen.

My stay was great , breakfast was good . People were incredible . It was very walkable , easy for visit the main spots in Quito . We found many touristic place very near , plaza grande, la Ronda, San Francisco church and my favourite la compañía de Jesús. There are also many options of street and affordable food around the area , I found a great lunch for 4 dollars.

Un lugar muy agradable, en una casa preciosa y al lado de todo en el centro histórico. Sobre todo, hay que recalcar la gran amabilidad de su personal, impecables y bien dispuestos para asesorar sobre planes y ayudar en lo que sea necesario.  Faltaría un cartelito pidiendo a algunos huéspedes que no levanten la voz hablando por el celular en áreas comunes. Por demás, excelente .

El hostel tiene un ambiente agradable y seguro  pero es importante que mejoren la Red WiFi dentro de la, habitaciones y colocar la opción de TV por cable para conocer más sobre Ecuador. Colocar jabones más grandes en el servicio de ducha.

Very safe, clean and good place to stay. The parking is very close. We enjoyed a big room and also we had a table with a dining table outside of our room. We found a good restaurant close tp the hotel.

direccion: Diego de Almagro E 8-19 esq. con Belo Horizonte, Quito 170518 Ecuador
descripcion: Located in Quito, Ecuador. First of one of many more to come. It's located in the best part of city. Totally centered, where you are less than 3km away from Downtown, the business part of town and the entertainment one. Ibis Hotel has the best facilities and a great quality services, and all of that for totally accesible prices. Our hotel is the best option for all kinds of traveling executives.

comentarios.p_comentario: Buenas instalaciones, limpio, buen bar y restaurante, carta amplia, atención muy amable, habitación sin ropero, no puedes adelantar el checking Buena ubicación habitación con útiles de aseo completo, desayuno muy bueno Buena opción con buena cama y ducha

Habitaciones pequeñas con electrodomésticos que dejan encendidos luces (testigos) y alumbran toda la habitación. Las ventanas no tienen aislamiento de ruido y dan a la calle lo cual se escucha todo el ruido exterior. Ducha pequeña y en mi caso no tenía jabón. Toallas viejas con bordes desechos.

Excelente hotel.  Súper cómodo, excelente atención por parte del personal. El desayuno buffet muy bueno y completo. La ubicación buena y segura en el centro norte de Quito, fácil para moverse.  Definitivamente será mi opción para los próximos viajes.

Extravié mi laptop durante mi estadía en el hotel y estaba 100% seguro de que había sido sustraída de mi habitación.   El hotel tuvo apertura total a revisar las cámaras de seguridad, logs de la habitación y tomó las acciones pertinentes, acompañando el caso y brindandome la contención necesaria.  Finalmente la laptop apareció en otro lugar y aceptaron la disculpa.

Lugar agradável, confortável, pessoal atencioso, limpo, bem localizado, valor da diária compatível. Recomendo a todos este hotel, perto de tudo, parques, shoppings, restaurantes. Silencioso acolhedor tem um bom café.

I stayed at the Ibis Quito for business. I was pleasantly surprised with the modern cleanliness of the hotel. Rooms were quiet. Very comfortable sleeping. The conference room on the 9th floor has wonderful views. The lobby vibe is great, welcoming, and friendly. Enjoy a meal or a drink. Breakfast was excellent and staff super friendly. I would definitely stay again.

Hotel propre et calme offrant toutes les options de confort pour un bon rapport qualité prix . Un peu excentré si l'on n'a pas de véhicule pour se déplacer.  L'espace petit déjeuner est vite encombré si il y a beaucoup de monde

Good location, walking distance to La Mriscal market. We had to take taxi to city center, no problem, cost 4-5 USD. Rather small room, but nice and clean with a view. Excelent breakfast. Helpfull stuff.

El hotel es relativamente nuevo con 3 años en operación, la relación precio calidad creo que es muy buena dadás las buenas condiciones de las instalaciones y su localización. El personal muy atento y el restaurante bastante accesible en precios

Unknown to visitors they do set lunched! They have a great cook, who is from Cuenca. The menus vary so call to make reservations the place fills up fast. We had a Bolas soup that was served piping hot! Along with a tasty shrimp and fish rice dish. The seafood tasted like it just came from the ocean. To top it off the nest rich chocolate cake. We left full NS satisfied! So recommend it !

direccion: Calle 24 de Septiembre S 2-389 Conector Alpachaca, Quito 170907 Ecuador
descripcion: Eb Hotel By Eurobuilding Quito Airport, is the second installment of the EB brand from the Eurobuilding Hotels chain, which is known providing a 5-star service and a luxury design experience throughout all of its 9 properties, located throughout Venezuela, Argentina and the United States. EB Hotel is open Since Octuber 2017. The EB Hotel is located just 8 minutes away from the new Mariscal Sucre International Airport in Quito at the area of Tababela, Metropolitan District of Quito. We are close to the different locations preferred by visitors, 30 minutes away from the city’s historic center and other tourist attractions such as the Andean mountain range, the Cotopaxi volcano and 20 minutes away from the center of the world. Other beautiful landscapes, like the Quilatoa volcano, are easily accessed as well. The hotel has been specially designed for business travelers, tourists and families in general, offering comfort, service and spaces that will inspire you and make your stay a pleasant experience.

comentarios.p_comentario: Excelente el hotel es hermoso sus habitaciones muy acogedoras,  la piscina deliciosa y su personal es excelente la atención que nos dan como huéspedes es muy agradable y te sientes en casa lo recomiendo 1000%

Fantastic hotel, with a beautiful decor, rooms very comfortable, magic beds, and the most important the people. Everybody on the hotel it’s always ready to help to make your stay much more comfortable that you could spect. By far my best estoy in Quito metropolitan area.

Eb Hotel is a wonderfully modern hotel with excellent service! Convenient to the Quito airport and a nice resting spot before or after any visit to the Galapagos. While not located in the Old Town, it is only a 1/2 hour ride away. They also provided transportation to the airport.

Como siempre excelente la estadia, muy confortable, se siente como en casa. El servicio más que excelente, el personal muy amable, en el top es el # 1 de los hoteles que he vistitado. Muy muy recomendado.

Each time I stay at EB I have a superb experience. The staff were very attentive and treated me very well. If you are looking for a quiet, comfortable  and beautiful hotel. EB should be your first choice.

@EurobuildingQuito un lugar muy acogedor , Limpio en su totalidad , me encanto todo , las áreas externas super lindas , respiras aire puro , las habitaciones super Relajantes y comodas , su personal super cordiales y amables . Un saludo a los chicos del área de recepción por tan gentil trato .  Quiero resaltar el área del servicio del restaurante  Sus platillos exquisitos y muy buena atención .  Felicidades   Y agradecerle a los que desde la llegada al restaurante mostraron una  cálida bienvenida.  Los chicos Euvi , Freddy y  Daniela , Gracias por todo y por mostrarse tan servicial en todo momento. Gracias , espero volver algún otro día

This hotel is our new favorite when flying in or out of Quito.  Their shuttle service is great and was there to greet us even though our flight time had changed.  They have helped us with 'early check-in and late check-out requests.  The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful.  The rooms are very nice and comfy and the breakfasts are great.   Looking forward to coming back soon on our next trip. We can highly recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Hotel with a great location if you search a short stay in Quito. If you are traveling on business, this is the perfect hotel for you. Staff is very accommodating and attentive. In addition, facilities are excellent.

Siempre es una maravillosa experiencia. Nos hemos alojado unas tres veces ya en este hotel, siempre con amigos y familia. La verdad lo hemos hecho para escapar de la rutina de Quito y por disfrutar un poco la piscina y el buen clima de Tababela.   La comida del restaurante es muy buena, el servicio del personal también.  Definitivamente es un lugar al que siempre que podamos volveremos.

Spectacular hotel.  Everything was very clean.  The front desk went out of their way to be helpful. They stored my bags several times while I did multi-day tours in other places.  The room was large and very comfortable.  Security was great,  you needed a key to go up the elevators to the rooms.  The restaurant had good food.  The gym was well equipped and clean.  The spa was great.  This is the only place that I will stay when I'm in Quito.

direccion: Av. Republica de El Salvador N 34-377, Quito 170150 Ecuador
descripcion: !Cool, elegant and classic! Quito is the capital of Ecuador has the largest and best-preserved historic center in Latin America; it´s the second highest capital in the world with an elevation of 2,850m above sea level. Its heritage treasure houses Churches, Museums and Cultural Centers. The Hotel is located in the heart of the financial and business center. It is close to the main shopping centers such as Quicentro, United Nations Avenue, Atahualpa Olympic Stadium and just two blocks from La Carolina´s Park. The hotel has 210 rooms, swimming pool, gym, restaurant, bar and 12 meeting rooms for corporate and social events with capacity up to 1100 people.

comentarios.p_comentario: We were a group of sixteen travelers, visiting Ecuador, and stayed at this beautiful hotel on our initial stage of our trip. We actually stayed at this hotel for our first two nights, and then for our final night of our twenty one day trip to Ecuador. Our first stay was at the five story tower, on the fourth floor. Very comfortable room, with the only issue being the loud thumping from the fifth floor, which started at 6 o'clock in the morning! We thought that it was music, but figured out that it was the sounds of people swimming at the pool! Our second stay, overnight before our departure home at the end of our trip, was in the newer tower, which was quiet by comparison. Very attentive staff-provided additional bottles of water when we went out on our daily trips. Great location, but stay from the fourth floor, under the gym and pool on the fifth floor!…

Zentral gelegen, sehr sauberes und großzügiges Hotel mit englischen Touch. Sehr reichhaltiges Frühstücksbuffet. Das Essen im hoteleigenen Restaurant war sehr gut und reichlich. Das Personal sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. In Laufeweite mehrere gute Restaurants und ein Einkaufszentrum. Nur der Wasserdruck in der Dusche lässt zu wünschen übrig. Unfreiwillige Wechselduschen.

This hotel is beautiful.  The lobby gorgeous, the surrounding area (and the hotel itself) full of restaurants and a beautiful park.  I'd definitely stay in this neighborhood again.  And probably this hotel, but I'd ask a few more questions.  The breakfast is amazing.  So many choices.  Staff attentive and helpful.  I had light dinner in the pub and found that staff also super friendly and helpful.  I was in a back tower, not sure if it was older than the front?  The room was sparse (but bathroom lovely) which is fine.  But when I was too hot I let them know.  They came up and lowered the temp.  But later when I was cold, I was unable to adjust... seems all the buttons are for show; nothing changed no matter what I pushed including off.  Where I was on the 4th floor, you cold hear base from music above .  Assuming from the gym?  Not a bother to me as I sleep with earplugs but heads up if you are sensitive.  You may want a lower room.  Lastly and most disappointing was when  I asked for assistance getting a cab.  Assuming that having them hail it would avoid tariff questions.  Instead, the valet quoted a higher than normal price and said they would not use the meter.  I took uber from there on out... getting the cabs to use the meter is frustrating.  Hoped my high end hotel would help me avoid that.    Again, I'd stay here again... it was that beautiful and great location.  But I would be more careful about my room selection and straighten out issues in the beginning of my stay.…

Una experiencia placentera durante mi estadía de 5 días visitando la ciudad por negocios.   Los chicos botones y seguridad unos cracks ! Muy profesionales en lo que hacen y atentos en todo momento.   En recepción hay que trabajar un poco más con el equipo.   Los espacios del hotel son perfectos, tienes lugares muy cómodos donde poder trabajar con tu computadora y tomarte un café.   El restaurante Opera una gran experiencia, especialmente por la calidad de servicio brindada de Eduardo, un gran elemento para la empresa indudablemente.   Las habitaciones excelentes y más aún por la calidad de limpieza y orden del equipo de ama de llaves, al llegar de un día de trabajo encontraba todo ordenado y te das cuenta de pequeños detalles por la posición de la cosas y creatividad y el tiempo que se tomó el camarero, estoy muy agradecido.  Sin duda alguna volveré!…

My husband kept raving about this hotel. Ignore any negative reviews you might spot here. Front desk staff were attentive and pretty fluent in English (although it’s presumptive to expect that wherever we travel). The hotel is on a quiet street for Quito and had double-glazed windows (unusual in this temperate climate) so it was super quiet. I got there at night and closed the heavy drapes; only in the morning did I discover there were blackout shades, too — a nice touch. Abundant hot water (not always a given in Ecuador) and a spacious room. This hotel felt very luxurious to us. The pool and workout area, which we did not have time to use, was amazingly well appointed. Breakfast buffet was pretty varied and phenomenal as well. We felt pretty spoiled staying here. When we were there the English Ambassador and his entourage were also staying there, so I think it’s considered to be a pretty good place.…

The blobby is gorgeous and the food was good but too many other issues to recommend.  We had a lamp in our room with a European plug but it wouldn't fit in the usual outlets. Wifi was spotty. No plugs by the beds, NO air controls in the room! At all!! Doors close loudly so you hear your neighbors. You have to have a reservation for the fitness center and pool and the web site says it closes at 2:30 on weekends.  But it is close to everything and you can walk to lots of restaurants.

Hotel Con excelente ubicación, las instalaciones son modernas, el personal es amable y su atención fue buena.  Solo para mejorar el desayuno, podrían tener mejor opciones de frutas y creo que se puede mejorar en el sabor de las comidas.  El restaurante del hotel es pequeño, pero su comida es bien preparada

I really had a great experience at this hotel. The bed was the most comfortable that I've had in a hotel in Ecuador, the staff was friendly, the location really couldn't be any better. There is so much to do around there. The attached cafe is delicious and has unique pastries. Loved the free pastry that the front desk sent up after check-in.

Hotel itself is beautiful! Great location! Walking distance to so many great places. They have private and reliable taxis you can trust right outside the door.Butler on our floor was also very nice and helpful.  Breakfast buffet was delicious. Concierge was every helpful, especially when my husband came down with a cold- he directed me to the closest pharmacy after calling the hotel dr for me. However, receptionist aren’t as warm and welcoming. They also move at their own pace; not in any hurry to help.

Waren für 4 Nächte im Hotel. Bei der ersten Reinigung keine Badehandtücher erhalten, nach Mahnung sehr spät erhalten. Nach der 2. Nacht nur 1 Badehandtuch! Schlüsselfunktion gelöscht. Sehr unfähig in der Rezeption!

direccion: Benalcazar N 6-26 Mejia, Quito 170401 Ecuador
descripcion: Carlota Hotel Carlota is the first design urban boutique hotel, in the historic district of Quito,Carlota is the first LEED certified Hotel in Ecuador and the first LEED certified design boutique Hotel in a UNESCO Heritage site.

comentarios.p_comentario: I seem to have a rather contrasting impression of the Carlota from that of other Tripadvisor contributors.  It’s a pleasant enough place to stay, but was far outshone by our other hotels in Quito and beyond.  The Carlota was our final stay in Quito - if it had been the first, then my feelings about it may have been different.  As it was, the unappealing and expensive food, high cost of the airport transfer (getting on for double the going rate) and tiny room felt designed to satisfy new arrivals to Ecuador who don’t yet know any better.  Those staff that we meet were friendly and helpful.  However, the front desk was often deserted, with no members of staff to be found anywhere.  Fortunately, the roof top bar seemed to be constantly manned, so we were never at risk of going thirsty.  The bar man was very welcoming and mixed some decent cocktails.  The hotel is well located for the sights of old town, although the congested road out front makes arriving by taxi an occasional chore.  Whilst a visually appealing space, the Carlota falls down on some of more basic qualities expected from a hotel in its price bracket.…

My husband and I tried to go to Carlota for Sunday brunch. We arrived a little past 10am, and the doors were locked but the receptionist came out and told us that brunch didn’t start until 11am (the website states that it starts at 10am). So we wondered around for a while and came back at 11. When we arrived at 11, the doors were still locked and after a while, the same receptionist came out and asked us if we had a reservation. We did not and she said they have a party of 18 and would be unable to seat us until 1pm. We were very frustrated that they could not accommodate anyone else besides the one party (even at the bar) and that she did not mention it previously when we came by the first time at 10am. She also did not offer to help us find any other alternative options. I would expect better service from such a highly rated hotel.…

I had lunch one day in this stylish hotel north of the central historic plaza.  I enjoyed two appetizers: one was seafood and the other was hummus. Both the food and service were both impeccable. The person who served me was very obliging.

The Carlota is not perfect. The rooms are a little quirky - some have steep stairs, some are quite small. It’s an old building. However, if the Carlota is not perfect, it’s staff most certainly are. In fact this is a hotel we would love to return to.  We stayed here three times during our trip to Ecuador and the Galapagos, as we passed through Quito. The hotel is ideally situated in the heart of the historic centre and a short walk away from the main square and presidential palace. It’s also a relatively safe place to walk from unlike some other hotels in the area.  What distinguishes this hotel was the absolute commitment of all of the staff to their guests. We encountered some difficulties with our onward travel arrangements, (absolutely nothing to do with the hotel) but these were sorted out by the hotel staff liaising with our travel agent. They literally made our holiday happen.  When we changed our plans at the very last minute, the chef (who had his coat on and was walking out the door) came back to cook us a lovely meal just for the two of us. He didn’t need to do this but he said that he was a chef and it was his job.   Above all, the staff ensured we felt at home here. That’s what a boutique hotel should do - recreate the feeling that you are among friends (especially when you are in a strange city far from home.)   To everyone who helped us during our stay, we can only say thank you for everything you did. The Carlota is a marvellous place to stay.…

I can't say enough good things about this hotel, the owner and the people who work here. My friends and I recently stayed at Carlota for 4 nights. It's a beautifully-designed boutique hotel in the center of Quito's Centro Historico that comes with highly personalized service. Special shoutouts to Ana, Eylem, and all of the hotel staff.  I thank you all for your warmth, friendliness, and grace.

Lugar muy acogedor. Tuve la oportunidad de pasar una linda tarde en el centro histórico de Quito. La comida estuvo excelente, el servicio un poco demorado. Sin embargo mi novia y yo salimos más que satisfechos. Los precios buenos acorde a la buena calidad de la comida.

Un lindo lugar para poder conversar comer rico y pasar una linda mañana en pleno centro histórico de Quito, el personal súper amable y sobre todo pendiente de todos los detalles muy recomendado por si quieren celebrar con un grupo de amigos o en pareja

We loved our experience at the Carlota.  This hotel is beautifully decorated and the staff were wonderful.  They did their absolute best to accommodate any of our needs.  Sebastian helped us plan and strategize our day so that we could make the best of our time in Quito.  He is amazing!  The location is perfect walking distance from all the sites in Old Town Quito.

Amazing rooftop experience. Best service to guests with local gastronomy and drinks. Incredible views from colonial downtown ! Facilities are nice and comfortable. Very clean and well maintained facilities. Highly recommended during your visit to Quito.

El Hotel Carlota tiene una vista privilegiada del centro histórico de Quito. Tuve la oportunidad de disfrutar del servicio de Brunch el cual lo recomiendo ya que cuenta con una variedad de opciones, ni hablar de las mimosas que son muy ricas acompañado con un ambiente muy tranquilo, relajante con una musica de acorde al momento.

direccion: Sucre Oe3-17 y Guayaquil, Quito 170401 Ecuador
descripcion: Quito's Colonial downtown area is the largest and best preserved architectural space in all the Americas and was designated by UNESCO as a World Cultural Heritage Site. Surrounded by this wealth of culture, history and tradition is the Hotel San Francisco de Quito, located in a XVII century colonial house, which was restored carefully, keeping all its original details. Our recently renovated rooms are completed equipped with private bathroom, television with cable TV, telephone and permanent hot water. Our spacious common room offers free Internet and WiFi. "Camino Real" Restaurant. Laundry service. Safety boxes. Luggage storage service. It also counts with an inspiring viewpoint "Balcón Quiteño" up to 25 meters high where you can appreciate the beauty of the old and charming city, taking you into a journey through colonial century. We offer single, double, triple and quadruple rooms, also suites.

comentarios.p_comentario: The hotel room was amazing! I wasn’t used to the beds yet since I live in the states. The bed was comfy after the first night! The views from all the way up top were amazing!! The people working were so nice!!

Un hotel muy ubicado en el corazón de la capital.  Los pros: 1. Personal amable 2. La habitación limpia 3. La ubicación 4. Check in y check out muy eficiente  5. Tiene una bonita vista desde la terraza  Los contra: 1. La calidad de descanso es bastante mala, existe ruido fuerte tanto al interior como al exterior del hotel, mi habitación literalmente temblaba cada vez que pasaba un vehículo por la calle.  2. Los colchones son muy duros 3. El desayuno es muy escaso (1 banana, 1 pan, 1 huevo revuelto, café y jugo)

Good location downtown close to the Basilica and The Square but after dark it is not safe (like most Quito). Nice view from top floor. The rooms are dirty, the shower is OK, breakfast is very simple: scrambles eggs, a piece of bread, a fruit and Real coffee what is very hard to find around Ecuador.

Personnel sympathique, chambres un peu bruyantes et petit déjeuner très frugal (jus de fruit, tranche de papaye, un petit pain +1 œuf brouillé). Cet hotel vait surtout pour son emplacement très central.

So we arrived here as  part of a tour group. You can barely tell its a place  to stay as it in the wall of other stores and you have to be buzzed in.    the front desk is to the left of this beautiful  open garden sitting area. The area is great to just chill out and have a drink.  The front desk sells beer for $2 and may of us stayed in this area after our dinner and just talked. The location is close to the beautiful  church and square but please be carefully after dark as its not safe.  The breakfest here is plain scrambled eggs, a breakfest roll, a slice of watermelon with coffee and tea. This unfortunately is pretty much the good of this place.  We had room # 1 omg. Its right of the front desk up the stairs first room to the left. The room felt very old and creepy. There is a big window door balcony thing but can't open to outside so its just a giant loud inconvenience.  As soon  as you step in hall its just lots of creaking noise and in room #1 the floor made even more noise walking  through. I understand old places have creaking old floors and  at first this wasn't terrible but it became nuts hearing people walk all night through the halls.   We had two full size  beds  in this room but one bed had hair all over under the covers yes I slept on top  of the sheets.  The bathroom  was not very clean either definitely  had mold in the shower and we didnt have soap just 2 small bottles of shampoo  but the worst part in this small bathroom there is a window that doesn't close fully and it is open to the stairwell. Yes we could see people walk up the stairs while we are in the bathroom. This to me  was the most distributing  thing. No safe in room either or hair dryer. I definitely  didn't  fall asleep here with  people yelling outside, sirens going off, sink dripping, cracking floors and dogs barking most of the night it was impossible  to fall asleep.   We were supposed  to stay another night after this night and return at the end of our trip but our travel group checked us out as many others in our group also had a terrible  experience.  This really isn't  a hotel but a nicer hostel  type place. If we were prepared for this type of place it be OK  but we just aren't  that type of traveler. We switched  to much better places. This isn't the worst place I stayed in but I definitely  would not stay again. Good luck.…

La ubicación es increíble, cerca a las iglesias, la plaza grande, lamentablemente cuando estuve en este lugar pude evidenciar muchas personas ambulantes y venta informal, algo peligroso transitar con paquetes, demasiada genta en las calles. Puedo rescatar lo bello que es el Centro Histórico en sus edificaciones e iglesias, muy cómodo este hotel por la cercanía.

Wonderful place, lots of character, super helpful staff. We had laundry done while staying there and it was very affordable. They were able to arrange drivers for us to the airport and back and also to the Equator museums. Definitely a great place and walking distance to some very beautiful churches.

Pros: -Central location to historic center - Sara at front desk very helpful and speaks English very well  - Interesting history to the building - Good hot water pressure.   Cons: - Very loud—from street noise as well as anyone talking in the lobby - The street in front of the hotel (Sucre) is a main protest route to the presidential palace. There were two protests in our 4-day stay, which meant horns blaring, people on megaphones and heavy police & military presence  - Significant amount of mold in our room (14). I have minor mold sensitivity and by the third night I was fully congested  - Breakfast is very limited  Personally, I would not stay here in my next trip to Quito.

Me gustó!!! Excelente opción en pleno Centro Histórico, seguro y tranquilo!!! Muy cerca de la Plaza Grande.  Linda casa histórica con bella ornamentación.  Habitación grande y buen baño. Desayuno en el restaurante histórico!... Pequeño supermercado al lado.

Very loud and hard to sleep! All the rooms have windows to the central garden and anytime anyone is talking in there, you can hear them. The hallways have old creaky floors and anytime someone walks outside your room, it wakes you up. Also a moderate amount of street noise.    Rooms are not exactly as pictured . Feels old and bedspreads are dank. Only one outlet by the bed which didn’t work. Small simple bathroom.   Nice central garden.   Not the best neighborhood. Lots of homeless, bustlers in the street, and the area closes down by 6pm. Would not want to walk alone there at night.   Very difficult to get to because of traffic. Since this is a pedestrian area, there aren’t many streets open for cars and it always takes a long time to get back.   The breakfast was some bread and jam and plain eggs without anything accompanying.  Very nice chef though.…

direccion: Cotopaxi No. 9 - 17 Esmeraldas, Quito 170130 Ecuador
descripcion: Finding an ideal family-friendly small hotel in Quito does not have to be difficult. Welcome to Vista del Angel Hotel Boutique, a nice option for travelers like you.Vista del Angel Hotel Boutique features a 24 hour front desk, a concierge, and room service. In addition, as a valued Vista del Angel Hotel Boutique guest, you can enjoy a hot tub and free breakfast that are available on-site. Guests arriving by vehicle have access to free parking.While staying at Vista del Angel Hotel Boutique, visitors can check out Plaza de la Independencia (Plaza Grande) (0.2 mi) and Palacio de Gobierno (0.3 mi), some of Quito's top attractions.When you’re feeling hungry, be sure to check out Lucia Pie House & Grill Quito, Lammhaus Grill&Bar, and Ati Korean Grill BBQ Restaurant, which are some barbeque restaurants that are popular with locals and out-of-towners alike.Should time allow, Quito Old Town, Calle La Ronda, and Iglesia de La Compania de Jesus are some popular attractions that are within walking distance.Vista del Angel Hotel Boutique puts the best of Quito at your fingertips, making your stay both relaxing and enjoyable.

comentarios.p_comentario: We did not regret this boutique hotel. I always looked forward to the breakfasts - a variety of breakfast foods, with personal service, and an incredible view while eating.   The only reason this is not a perfect score is for the following reasons: the room we stayed in was small with 'stuffy' air, even with the window open; the TV did not work; and staff really did not know the answer to a lot of our questions, even with speaking Spanish. For instance, we asked about the free walking tour, which staff new nothing about. And yet right on their reception desk, in front of staff, was a pamphlet for the free walking tours.   The windows opened to the interior hallway, so you cannot get fresh air. And by opening the window you lose your privacy, and hear the hallway noise.   Again, it was worth it for the property in general, the views, and breakfasts.…

We had a quick 1 night layover in Quito and chose this hotel based on the views. It did not disappoint!! We booked a city view and throughly enjoyed the views! The staff was lovely and helped us find a wine opener so we could enjoy a glass of wine in the room before dinner. Then we had an amazing dinner in the restaurant. It might be pricy for Ecuador standards ($90 for 2 appetizers, 2 entrees, bottle of wine and dessert), but the food was on par with gourmet restaurants in the US! Breakfast was absolutely amazing, too (bread, croissants, fruit, yogurt, eggs, espresso coffee, smoothie) and was included in the hotel stay. We’d definitely stay here again!!

We had a wonderful 2 night stay at this lovely hotel with the most spectacular view...once you have climbed the steep streets to the hotel which was well worthwhile. Unfortunately, there were protests in Quito at the time which curtailed our sightseeing but the staff were really caring, especially when my son was suffering with altitude and exhaustion after a long journey. They couldn't have been kinder and more attentive - bringing him fresh bread that they went out to buy especially, and making him pots of coca tea and fresh juice to help him recover. We were looked after so well and will be back to explore this lovely city some more, I hope! Thanks

Les plus la localisation, la terrasse avec une vue incroyable et chauffée ( le rêve pour l’apéro) le responsable de la réception charmant, efficace et attentionné . La chambre est petite ( pas d’armoires ) et la salle de bain très petite . La Qualité de l’insonorisation est un soucis, si vos voisins arrivent ou partent en pleine nuit vous vivez leurs mouvements en direct. Le resto le soir est un dépannage utile si vous ne souhaitez pas sortir mais plutôt décevant Donc au total du très bien et du moins bien.

Vista del Angel was fantastic.  The views from everywhere on the premises are great.  We had a room with a view of the Panecillo and it was gorgeous lit up at night.  The staff were all very friendly and helpful.  They were quick with a recommendation and helped us get a cab to the airport at 345am.  Breakfast is included and isn’t to be missed.  It’s upstairs on the third floor with awesome views of the city.  It’s also delicious with three courses, a yogurt with granola and fresh fruit, pastries, and eggs.  We had dinner there once and it was tasty as well.  The location is second to none. It’s halfway between the old town and the cathedral and about a 5-10 min walk to either.  It is on top of a hill so if you have trouble with altitude make sure to take it slow.  Overall we would recommend this place to anyone and would definitely stay here again.…

This hotel is incredibly beautiful! Lots of unique art pieces and the location is very walkable. It’s very romantic! There’s tons of stellar views throughout. The rooms are quiet and peaceful. Everyone was very kind and accommodating. We loved our dinner and breakfast, super yummy! It’s a must stay!

Wat ene fantastisch mooi hotel.   Het uitzicht is adembenemend en super super gaaf! Overal verse bloemen!  Ontvangst zeer gastvrij  Eten, zeer goed lekker en mooie prijs  Kamers, schoon groot en super gezellig.   Ontbijt, beste ever! Zo goed zo vers zo lekker! Echt een aanrader!  Ik denk nog vaak terug aan dit hotel. Dank voor jullie gastvrijheid!   Dikke 10!

We had a good time here.  Henry was very helpful with everthing from booking to covid tests.  The meals were awesome.  Susanna and Maricarmen were very attentive.    Walk down the hill was enjoyable.  Going back up... not so much.  Taxi up was 2 bucks.

The Vista del Angel is a converted castle in the middle of the historic district of Quito, and I felt like royalty while I was there. They helped us organize transport from the airport, and Alex met us at arrivals with a sign with our name. Once we arrived to the hotel, Christian came out to the car with an opened umbrella for the short walk to the front door, as it was raining.  The bed was cushioned and firm and was the best we experienced while on vacation. However, the best part of our one night here was the incredible breakfast included with the stay. It was an extensive western breakfast, full of local flavors, and delicious!  Plus, the views from the third floor restaurant of Quito can not be beat.  We did not explore the neighborhood immediately outside the hotel walls.

Wonderful, helpful, polite staff (particularly Henry and Christian), delicious, well-presented breakfast and dinner.    Away from the hustle and bustle, with an exceptional view of the city.    Easy walk down, but steep walk or cheap cab ride to get back up.

direccion: Av Gonzalez Suarez N27-142, Quito 170109 Ecuador
descripcion: Located in the heart of the most exclusive residential and corporate area. With an incomparable view to the city or valley from every guestroom. The Hotel lays on a 7.5 Acres, superbly located on top of a hill, overlooking Quito's metropolis and volcanoes. Next door to the U.S. Ambassador's Residence.

comentarios.p_comentario: Lo que puedo rescatar de este Hotel como bueno es: su ubicación. Me pareció costoso contra la comodidad de la habitación, pocas opciones de menú, el personal no es muy calido ni servicial (incluso en medio de mi checkin tuve que presenciar el regaño del jefe a su equipo)instalaciones viejas con olor a humedo.  A la mañana siguiente le indique a la recepcionista sobre el ruido en la habitación que duro toda la noche y el pobre desayuno que tuvimos, pero no dio explicaciones.  Rescato el recibimiento y atención de ANicolas de recepción y el botones.

Quito´s weather, at night, could be below 10 Celsius.   Hotel Quito does not have hot water.    I presented my complains.  However, for three nights, nobody could help. Even switching rooms…. no hot water in the hotel.   Service is neither gentle, nor efficient. You have to pay in cash when ordering room service, event tough your credit card is at front desk. I did not have a good experience in general

Excelente estadía ! Lo recomiendo 100%   Un clásico de Quito con una muy buena locación , vista hermosa y un restaurante excelente ! Muchas gracias a todo el equipo ! La recepción , Hsk y especialmente a Sandra del restaurante techo del cielo ! Volveremos pronto!

I spent a week in Hotel Quito. The view from the bedroom was amazing. Rooms are very clean and tidy.  Staff were friendly, warm and hospitable.  The food was excellent. I  loved the herbal tea. I enjoyed my stay in Ecuador.

An ok city hotel.  Not very convenient for the airport or the old city.  nowhere really to walk to from here.  The restaurant on the top floor is prompt and has fine food and good service.   The room is ok as is the wifi.  Pleased that they have pump bottles in the bathroom.   I was cold and they promptly brought a radiator heater to my room.

La ubicación del Hotel es perfecta ya que a la salida podemos encontrar variedad de restaurantes y esta cerca de los centros comerciales. El servicio del hotel es muy bueno, las habitaciones son impecables, amplias y se muestran tal cual como nos enseñan en las fotos. El buffet de desayuno es variado y la comida es buena.

Visitando un Lindo Destino. Quito . Nos recomendaron este hotel el cual nos dió expectativa de una agradable estancia. En la segunda noche q decidimos extender , cuando fui a realizar el pago fui atendiendo por una resepcionista le doy mi tarjeta de crédito y me comentó q no servía, le pedí q me facilita alcohol y un paño o tela para limpiar algo de sucio o grasa q pudiera tener la tarjeta pues es una tarjeta nueva y con suficiente fondos para el pago , le digo q me esperen un rato y busco quien del grupo puede pagar mientras Yo soluciono el percance de mi tarjeta. luego se acerca su otra compañera de ella me dicen q si no pago me retire de el hotel Funcionarios como está dos resepcionistas don los q no dejan q podamos tener un Excelente recordatorio por una Buena institución. Un hotel presta un servicio por tal sus Funcionarios don prestadores de servicios ( deben de ayudar a solucionar los inconvenientes a sus visitantes, a que todo des plácido y agradable. Gracias…

Hotel Quito was a life saver for my husband and myself.  Caught in the Covid-19 Pandemic in March the government required me to be in quarantine after a hospitalization and testing for Covid-19.  The hotel that we had checked-out of was closing because of the pandemic.  My husband had located the Hotel Quito.  We called and they accepted us for a two-week quarantine stay.  The price included three meals a day, delivered to our room. The room was a king room with a balcony overlooking the pool and the hills and valley.  A real plus when wanting some fresh air and a great view!  The meals were plentiful and delicious.  The service and staff were exceptional.  Always willing to assist with our numerous questions.  Without a doubt we would return to the Hotel Quito again.

We had a relaxed stay at this well run hotel.  The dinner options were quite limited.  Excellent ice cream and very good breakfast.  Staff were highly capable and good natured.  Convenient place from which to set forth and see this lovely city.

This hotel is located within walking distance of downtown. Try to get a room in the back of hotel overlooking the huge heated pool and beautiful landscape. If your hungry they have a nice restaurant however a little expensive.Just across the street is a very nice pizza shop. We took a walk down the main street at night and felt very safe Can't go wrong if you stay here.

direccion: Avenida Orellana 1172 y Avenida Amazonas, Quito 170150 Ecuador
descripcion: Visit Quito, Ecuador in style when you stay at JW Marriott Hotel Quito. Our luxury hotel is ideally located near the area's best dining, shopping, attractions and entertainment. Get to Galapagos Islands and Santo Domingo's Church easily from our Quito hotel. Take advantage of our full service spa, decadent restaurants, state-of-the-art fitness center and gorgeous pool.

comentarios.p_comentario: My family and I stayed here for 2 nights before our trip to Galápagos.    I contacted Concierge via email in advance of our trip and they (Fernando & Alejandra) were super helpful in arranging dinner reservations for our 2 nights.   While the hotel looks a bit aged and needs some refurb, the staff, from bell men to front desk to exec lounge to restaurants, are all incredible friendly and helpful.   Breakfast quality was very good as was the variety.    A good choice for your stay in Quito

Stated 3 nights pre Galapagos Cruise in room 811, and one night room 735 on return. Very spacious and well appointed. Excellent internet which we needed for work. Beautiful hotel overall with great meal choices, beautiful pool area. Service was first rate from checkin to arranging private drivers and tours.   Special kudos to Fabian at the front desk who tracked down my misplaced cellphone for me on Aeromexico and arranged a reuniting. Truly service above and beyond and a bit of a lifesaver as we are mobile dependent these days.   As good as any Marriott we have stayed in and at a very good price. All staff spoke good English (good since our Spanish sucks).

Estuve de viaje con mi esposo y temas de negocios, la habitacion estuvo muy chida, la atencion fue excelente desde que llegue el doorman me ayudo, la recepcion fue amable y lo mejor fue el desayuno, hay tamales y una salsa picante deliciosa. La hostess estuvo pendiente todo el tiempo. realmente buen servicio.  La piscina es perfecta, un poco fria al principio pero te acostumbras ! seguro volvemos

Beautiful hotel and the room is very spacious for a standard room! Check in was easy and all the staff were very pleasant and friendly! The bell man got my luggage and got to my room promptly! There were two bottles of water provided in our room! There’s an empty mini fridge in the room, so you can use it for your own stuff!  There’s a restaurant close by that’s pretty good, a 5 minute walk! It was about 45 mins drive from Quito airport!

The best Marriott we've ever stayed in! From the design of the hotel to the guest room, the restaurants to the staff, every single thing was simply perfect. Fabulous restaurants with great food and great service. The staff cares and it shows! The entire kitchen staff came out after one dinner and asked to take their picture with us! We cannot recommend this hotel enough. It was the host hotel for our Galapagos trip and just added to the entire experience!

While waiting for our Galapagos trip to begin, we were fortunate to stay at this JW Marriott. So not to get caught up in some civil protests in Quito, we opted to stay in and dine at their new restaurant Raices. Little did we know how new it was until we walked in and we treated like celebrities!. Unwhittingly, we were the very first customers to walk in their doors! After celebratory drinks we were treated with an exquisite plate of a delicious scallop appetizer. Then of course we had to try this and that from the menu and enjoyed every bite. Sauces were prepared at the table and we even got more desserts after our deserts! kudos to the fabulous chef and his team!

Excellent hotel. Exceded my expectations. Top Noch service. Daniela and Oscar from the reception made our stay very special and took great care of us and our twins.  They were always amazingly polite and professional. Fabian and Francisco at the executive lounge were extremely kind with us. Our kids enjoyed beautiful live piano at the lobby and a refreshing pool every day. Beautiful flower decorations made our stay unforgettable. We would be delighted to come back.

I had the pleasure to travel to Quito for business and staying at JW Marriott. This is an amazing option to stay in Quito, Ecuador. Front desk representative Gabriela went out of her way and gave an extra mile to make sure that my time was extraordinary. Where to start, Check in was good, room was impecable, breakfast and all food in general were very tasty. The check out was really nice with an extraordinary surprise! Thank you so very much to all!

It is located near many shops and restaurants that are all walkable if there is no rain.  The hotel is gorgeous, very spacious, high end quality and very luxurious at a fair price.  The staff is also helpful and extraordinary for most needs.  The downside is when big cruise ship tours come in, the place gets crowded and chaotic.

Excellent service , a real can do attitude, typical JWM rooms, had benefit of upgrade due to my Ambassador Elite status  Excellent lounge on 9th floor nice views and full breakfast with Omelet station.  Also had meal in Botanica on the lower level also good with exemplary service  The concierge, Ayquel Garzon, could not have been more attentive. The city itself is very friendly and clean. Highly recommend visiting Quito and do stay at the JW.
